reviews.text: I&#39;ve been here twice now, and this place is always packed. So be expected to wait a bit, and don&#39;t count on sitting down while you wait since everyone seems to stand in the entryway.  <br><br>I must admit for being such a big establishment their food is excellent! Full of flavor and a huge serving, I always make a mistake of ordering something for myself instead then sharing with my girlfriend. Oh well, they will pack it up to go for you kc you ask for a do go box. It is convenient for me since I always worry about spilling my food on the transition from plate to box. <br>This place is on the pricey side, but as mentioned before you get a pretty big serving, it&#39;s almost like you&#39;re getting dinner and lunch for the next day. <br><br>The wait staff tries their best to keep up with the massive volume of people that are here at any given time. So keep that in mind. If you&#39;re in a hurry, you might consider someplace else. Or if you&#39;re easily annoyed, then work on it. Lol! <br><br>Overall I&#39;d recommend this place, with a disclaimer of the cost and the wait. But the fold is pretty good! Do I even need to mention their Cheesecake, I mean its on the name!<br><br>​

This specific location holds a special place in my heart. I met one of my good writer friends here some years back. We had a great time talking about our writing plans and life in general. I miss my friend. She passed away almost three years ago. May she rest in peace. She was amazing and I learned so much from her.    <br>I haven&#39;t been here in awhile but I&#39;ve enjoyed it every time. The service has always been great. There&#39;s many options on the menu. My favorite item out of everything is the mango key lime cheesecake. It&#39;s wonderful! The mango mousse, whipped cream and crust are all perfect together! My second favorite cheesecake is the chocolate mousse. Delicious! I understand The Cheesecake Facory has 250 items on their menu! Talk about variety! I&#39;ve also tried their fettuccine alfredo and it&#39;s great too! It tasted creamy and fresh. Their salads are also tasty and fresh. There&#39;s been talk of one opening up in El Paso but I doubt it. I think the prices are too steep for this market.
As always never disappointed when I eat at the Cheesecake Factory. My boyfriend, daughter and I all had delicious dinner. I of course had to have the pumpkin cheesecake which was to die for.

THIS PLACE BLOWS.  Our waitress was a complete B and was quite sarcastic and condescending to us when we didn&#39;t realize the 2 for 2O deal on the hamburgers was to go only.  We had no time for her crap and Walked out never to return. <br><br>Shame on you Cheesecake Factory!

Arrived at 7:50pm on a Friday, I expected it to be busy. I was told a wait time of an hour, that was my limit so I figured I could wait. I didn&#39;t receive a call, so at 8:50 I walked back up to the hostess to just double check. She said it would be another 30 minutes. How could your estimate be so far off? Your only job is to figure out wait times. Nothing new is going on, covid has been a thing for a while, you should be able to take that into account by now. So I&#39;m supposed to go sit down 30 minutes before closing? This was my favorite restaurant and I&#39;m so soured I won&#39;t be back.

I had not been to a Cheesecake Factory in over 10 years. Every since I moved to New Mexico from Florida. My grandson and I just got back from having lunch and I am absolutely pleased with the quality and quantity of food served. The service was even better. I had the Chicken Piccata. Absolutely delicious. It was perfectly prepared. There isn&#39;t an Italian restaurant in ABQ or Rio Rancho that can compare. Very impressed. My Grandson had their Bacon Bacon Burger and he says it is the best bacon burger he has ever had. We ordered 3 slices of cheesecakes to go. Will be eating them this evening. I will be returning to Cheesecake Factory very soon.

Came in with my 4 kids in tow. They enjoyed the food and the waitress was great with their craziness (thankfully no spills). My herb encrusted salmon was cooked perfectly and the mashed potato&#39;s were delicious. Really enjoyed the lunch. Was really interested in the brunch, we will be back to try those cinnamon pancakes!

The service is always a hit or miss at this place, today was better than last time.  Food is always great so we keep coming back. Unfortunately one of the entrees we wanted was already sold out. Thankfully there are lots of other options. The place was clean and moderate noise as usual. This is the 2nd time we had a birthday party here. Unfortunately being the Cheesecake Factory they don&#39;t have  a free slice to give you on your birthday.  Better luck neck time. I&#39;m probably going back again and maybe the review will be better.

The Cheesecake Factory is always pretty good. Even when the food it bad, it&#39;s still pretty good. My favorite is the macaroni and cheese burger which should lowkey be illegal because of how many calories are in it. But it is the most delicious indulgence ever and I try to consume food here in moderation. A meal with cheesecake and an entree can be well into 2000 calories. Everything good here comes with a price when it comes to health so if you&#39;re trying to eat healthy, this is never the place to come. It is a great treat every now and then! This time we also got the strawberry cheesecake which is my personal favorite. I find the other cheesecakes have way too much going on and are too sweet to enjoy. The strawberry has the perfect balance!

Why do people think gloves are magic?  Touching/making change with them and then grabbing a slice of carrot cake from display plate and placing into container does not have any logic to me. What&#39;s the thought process in ones head. It&#39;s actually gross to think about what&#39;s on my cake now

We visited The Cheesecake Factory yesterday for the first time since it opened here, although we&#39;ve eaten at other locations in the past. <br><br>We wanted breakfast since it was around 10:15 a.m. and they didn&#39;t disappoint. My husband had chicken and waffles while I had the create your own omelet and a side of bacon. <br><br>I always order my omelets well done because I don&#39;t like them wet or loose in the middle and very crispy bacon. At many restaurants we&#39;ve been to, the bacon has to go back to be crisped up, but not here. Everything was cooked just as I asked and was delicious. <br><br>We were impressed by not only our breakfast, but in how the entire staff worked to support each other, making sure guests were well taken care of. We never had an empty glass or dirty plates sitting on the table. It was a wonderful visit and a little slice of specialness to start a busy weekend and if you haven&#39;t tried breakfast or brunch here, I&#39;d recommend you do.

Food is good and service is good. So far the couple of times I have went I have tried a new cheesecake but the tiramisu cheesecake was ok it didn&#39;t meet my expectations. The pineapple upside down cheesecake cake has been by far my favorite. I haven&#39;t tried them all but so far the one of my choice is the pineapple upside down cheesecake.

I grew up in Orange County, CA, so I&#39;ve always been a fan of The Cheesecake Factory.  I don&#39;t go to the Abq location often at all because I try to support local and what not.  However, I was craaaaving my favorite dish - Cashew Chicken with rice.  Honestly, I can never go wrong with this dish.  Oftentimes, you know how takeout/delivery can be questionable or &#34;it&#39;s just not the same when you order takeout and then eat it at home&#34;? Well, I was so pleased with it all! YUM! <br><br>Huge shoutout to the employee who took my order on the phone and ran it out to my car upon pickup.  I really wish I remembered his name, but it was a Saturday night and I just want to give him big props for his clarity and patience on the phone and friendly service in person. Working in the service industry myself, I truly appreciate these qualities when ordering food/drinks (from the customer and the employee). Good job, dude, and thanks Cheesecake Factory!
Always good food and Great Service. Would give 5 Stars but they did away with customized guacamole.  Wonderful salads especially the Cobb salad with Chicken

Waited for a table for 6 for 2 hours. No big deal...6 is the maximum number allowed. When we&#39;re finally seated we get 2 tables for 3 and are told there are no other options. Really screwed up my friend&#39;s birthday. We were repeatedly told they had tables for 6. Why lie about it?

Thank you Cheesecake Factory for making things right. We did visit the Cheesecake Factory again... on your dime :). While my first two menu choices were sold out (disappointing)...  third time&#39;s a charm- and I got to enjoy pretzel bites with fondue- just the right mix of my two favorite food groups- Cheese &amp; Bread.  Our server really made the whole experience worth it: he was a great sport, and a super nice kid (his mother must be proud!!!). Thanks again Cheesecake Factory!

Went there for lunch...first time! It is very beautiful and elegant in there.  I had the Truffle honey chicken and the stuffed mushrooms.  The chicken was juicy, asparagus perfectly grilled and the mashed potatoes were delicious.  The stuffed mushrooms were very nice! My friend got the avocado beet salad and the egg roll sampler. Both were very delicious also!! The sauces on the sampler were very interesting and different.   We shared a mango key lime cheesecake...it was amazing! The crust has a macadamia coconut mixture.  I will be back! It is a bit pricey but they give you huge portions and our waiter Alberto was wonderful!! The presentation on the food was beautiful..you hated to eat it!

Stuck in hospital with horrible hospital food, decided to treat myself to a decent meal, whatever the price.  Cheesecake is a chain but I&#39;ve eaten in this restaurant in other cities and experience was pretty good.  Photos were appetizing.  Entree - almond-crusted salmon over greens for 16.95 - and beet and avocado salad  for $8.50 - looked NOTHING like the photos when order arrived.  Really skimpy salad, with a few tiny pieces of avocado and beets. Small salmon slice over lots and lots and lots of parsley, maybe 4 cranberries.  It was nice to see the included bread, but they included 2 small pats of butter for 6 slices of bread. AND NO KNIFE, FORK OR SPOON, even though I indicated that I needed utensils.  All of this for $36.47.<br>This site is closed for indoor dining - you would think they would put some effort into their take-out to generate revenue.<br><br>A real rip-off. Will never order from them again.

Lol I got ripped the PHU off  so like can I get a free slice or something. Because wtf I was better off going to get a Cinnabon instead of a half ass slice of really expensive cheesecake. My slice vs. my bf&#39;s slice, like what the heck. Furious

I love this place, not just good for cheesecake. They have an amazing selection of food and alchohol. I forgot the name of my favorite dish because this is being written after I had my visit. The dish was a marinated steak with wasabi mash potatoes and asparagus. It is so good, though the asparagus could be better. Next time I go I will probably tade those out for a different side. The alcohol is always amazing, I never get the same thing twice, yet still impressed. Plus I can easily say that the cheesecake is close to perfection.

For many years I have been told that this place was one I had to go too. I recently went with a friend for dinner.  The food was average and nothing special.  There was nothing that made it stand out for me.  The cheesecake was good the interesting thing is that there is no prices on the different options.  You are given a price range rather than an actual price.  Service was okay again nothing special.  For all the hype I have heard it did not hit the mark.

I hate to be negative, but meh, I&#39;ve experienced better pretty much sums this place up.  The food is averagely tasty, and I haven&#39;t been overly disappointed with the taste at the time of dining, but the prices are outrageous. Three of us dined here for almost $80.  I think that $27 a person for chicken, burgers, and one slice of cheesecake is crazy.  The food is aveerage, but it&#39;s not that good.  <br><br>I ordered a honey chicken and it was relatively tasty.  The pre-dinner bread that is offered is pretty good (honestly the best part of the dining experience), and the iced teas are flavorful.  I just can&#39;t say that I would recommend this place to anyone.  The place is beautiful inside.  The cheesecakes are okay if you are into them, but honestly, they are very heavy (along with being very expensive).  All the food, even the lighter objects are very heavy.  Also, just to say, in regard to the food that I ordered, the honey chicken is only good on the first day, but don&#39;t plan to reheat it in the microwave the next day because it gets soggy and un-flavorful (unfortunately the honey flavor seems to get overpowered by the greasiness). On a better note, I think another favorite part to my meal was the asparagus, because you can&#39;t really mess that one up...  <br><br>I guess if you are having a special event, or if you really want to splurge on your dining, give this place a run...  However, with the high food prices, the lacking waitstaff, and the semi-long wait times, I would suggest trying something more memorable.

My husband and I came to celebrate him getting a promotion, and we were seated almost immediately.  Our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable.  She answered any questions we might have and even anticipated some.   Our food was brought out and everything was correct (we both made modifications to our order).  The food itself was cooked really well and we both loved our food.  The portions here are huge so we ended up taking our cheesecake home, but we loved that too. It was a really nice experience, and if we are going to eat at a chain restaurant again, it&#39;s definitely still on the list ;) great service, good food, and cheesecake. Can&#39;t argue with that ;)

Food is goos. Wait is often ridiculously long unless you go during off peak times. Food was very salty during my last visit and wait staff was mediocre. I do love the many options and the dessert. We go for the many dinner options available.

I think The Cheesecake Factory is one of the must visit restaurants when in town. It&#39;s a beautiful place with high ceilings and elegant decorations. Their menu is overwhelming- they have pages and pages of items with a variety of cuisines. This is my second time being here within 3 years. Our server Emmet was very sweet and did a great job taking care of us. We started off with the macaroni and cheese balls. They were bigger than anticipated; about the size of an extra large meatball. They were okay but mine was slightly cold in the center. The complimentary bread is always so delicious. I ordered the chicken piccata and was given a big portion. One thing about this place is that it is more on the expensive side but they dishes are a decent size. This dish set me back about $17. The taste was good but needed more lemon. There was a lot of butter coming through and not much else. We ended our meal with the mango key lime cheesecake- delicious but so decedent and overly sweet. This is definitely a place to go every once in a while due to the heavy portions and hefty calories in each dish. I&#39;ll definitely be back later on to try some different menu items and deliver and overall verdict.

I&#39;ve visited The Cheesecake Factory in many different cities and states and I&#39;m never disappointed. One of my favorites are the fried macaroni and cheese ball appetizers. Sooooo delicious. <br><br>In all the times I&#39;ve gone I&#39;ve never ordered a burger. Tonight I ordered a Hickory Smoked BBQ burger and it was really tasty. The burger meat was cooked perfectly to my liking (slightly pink) and the bacon on it was thick and slightly sweet... maybe some syrup or maple on it? It was piled high with onion rings. The BBQ sauce was uber sweet and a tad of spice. So good. <br><br>I order the sweet potato fries with it and they were salty and presented well. They were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Very good! <br><br>Our server seemed pretty rushed. She was nice enough and on top of our order but I hope she does stop and smell the cheesecake occasionally. <br><br>I ordered cheesecake to go but I only ate half my burger and am too full for it tonight. I suppose I&#39;ll have to have chocolate mousse cheesecake for breakfast. DARN! Haha! <br><br>Thanks Cheesecake Factory for never letting me down!  <br><br>Cheers!

My boyfriend and I visited tonight, food was disgusting very disappointing because the server was great the cheesecake is the only thing worth getting their quesadillas have way to much cheese and greese uneditable...salmon was burnt after the server promised it won&#39;t be and burgers taste like McDonald&#39;s the only thing we enjoyed was the cheesecake that we took home...

We have been so crazy busy and we come in for a relaxing me and we get the best service, the best food and outstanding customer service! Seriously kudos to Jordan our server who was top notch! Provided great customer interaction and his recommendations were spot on!! Thank you for a great meal and a great fun night!!

I was excited to get take out for my birthday! We ordered spaghetti and meatballs then for dessert pumpkin cheesecake! I took a bite of the cheesecake first and that was so amazing then I took another bite with some whipping cream BUT this time there was a hair!!!! We could not even eat any of the food because this stray hair ruined our meal and appetite! so gross and during the COVID pandemic!

We received a $50 gift card for Christmas. So we saved it until we were able to have some sort of a date night. With 4 kids its almost impossible to make that happen especially with COVID-19. We were able to get out parents to watch 3/4 of our kids. So we were stoked about being able to get take out from here. The service was quick, but our food was cold and not the best for 16$ pasta plates. This was my second experience here that wasn&#39;t the best.

Ah the Cheesecake Factory, home to one of my weaknesses, cheesecake. The day I heard they opened this place here in Albuquerque my home I almost broke down and cried in joy. I&#39;d previously visited the other locations in Denver, and various ones in Texas and it always bummed we out that we didn&#39;t have one. I was so delighted that we finally got it. Sadly this is actually only my second visit to the one at home. In all the time it&#39;s been open. Why? Well let&#39;s start off by saying this place can be pricey. A slice of their own cheesecake can easily run you $8. Wow! Don&#39;t get me wrong the food I&#39;ve had is quite delicious and has not let me down but it&#39;s definitely not somewhere I find myself going on a weekly basis. We had gone during peak hours at 6 in the evening which I was hesitant as I know how busy that place can be. Luckily our wait was about 15 minutes and we were seated in the outdoor patio. We had a little visitor (pigeon) stop by our table and walking around scrounging for food it was funny. Our waitress came about 8 minutes later to take our drink orders and arrived with the drinks 6 minutes later which was enough time to decide what to order. I decided this visit I would change it up and order something different. I tried their fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. I&#39;m a creature of habit and I find myself ordering the same thing that I enjoy at different places. Alfredo is a hit or miss with me. There are only a small handful of places I find to have a good fettuccine Alfredo. I felt bold this go around so when it arrived I could smell the aroma of creamy Alfredo and chicken. The noodles on the top of the dish were a little chewy but the rest of the noodles were pretty soft. The noodles unfortunately did not hold up well when twisted with guidance of the spoon. I found the noodles to break easily and not twist well. The Alfredo itself was very creamy and with the cheese they spread on top it wasn&#39;t watery or too thick. Sometimes I&#39;ve found some places to have a thick Alfredo that doesn&#39;t soak well with the noodles. Cheesecake Factory had it just right. The chicken was good but it did feel a bit tough and dry like chicken you&#39;ll find in a progresso soup can. It as freshly cooked just a little tough. If the chicken had been more softer and juicer I would&#39;ve enjoyed it more. My friend wanted spaghetti and meatballs but our waitress informed us they were out of the meatballs but suggested another dish that was similar with alternative meat. I forgot what is called honestly but my friend gave me taste and it was ok but I&#39;m not much of spaghetti fan. Overall we had great service, and the food was decent. This place can be a bit pricey so be prepared to at least spend anywhere between $15 to $30 a dish depending on what you want so fair warning. I definitely recommend coming least to get the experience and enjoy one of their delicious cheesecakes!

Okay, so...obviously I&#39;ve been to dozens of these places before. The problem was I wasn&#39;t Yelping back when I lived in Oklahoma and would frequent this place constantly every other weekend when I would drive up to the capitol. If I were, I would tell you guys that they are just as amazing as ever, regardless of which one you go to. But the experience varies based on service. The food is almost always good. Usually.<br><br>Let&#39;s talk about the first night I went to the Cheesecake Factory here in the land of enchantment. I ordered the shrimp scampi, which is a bistro take on the traditional dish. Basically, it&#39;s deep fried shrimp in a scampi sauce. In this iteration, everything as far as the sauce was spot on. Unfortunately, they took the misstep of burning some of the shrimp. So I thought to myself, &#34;okay...everyone has a bad night. no biggie. I&#39;ll let it pass.&#34;<br><br>I mean, we were already planning on returning here our last night in Albuquerque, we love the place that much.<br><br>This second visit, I was determined to try the steak diane. But I didn&#39;t want that to be the only protein I had, just in case I didn&#39;t like it for whatever reason. So I got the factory combo of shrimp scampi (almost everyone deserves a second chance, after all) and the steak diane.<br><br>Firstly, I am happy to report that the scampi was MUCH better this time around. All the shrimp were cooked perfectly with nothing singed or burnt. The sauce was just like I remember it. Plus it all blended beautifully with the mashed potatoes. Yeah...the combos come with mashed and Cheesecake Factory actually makes a damn good mashed.<br><br>That said, we can discuss the steak diane. It was....different for me. Took some getting used to because honestly, I have nothing else to compare it to. I&#39;ve never really had a steak diane before, much less know much about it. I know that it&#39;s a recipe generally consisting of a pan seared steak of sorts, tossed in a mushroom-ish sauce with black peppercorn and onions. Only the sauce Cheesecake Factory uses is slightly sweet. Again, not quite what I was expecting. But overall, it wasn&#39;t bad. At least I had the benefit of the mashed potatoes to counterbalance the mild sweetness brought on by the sauce.<br><br>The steak itself was cooked a perfect medium as requested. But you&#39;ll notice from the pic I took that they serve this steak *almost* hibachi style. That&#39;s what it reminded me of really. Most places just leave the whole piece of steak uncut. This one came in pieces. Not really a deal breaker for me; just....different.<br><br>I know that some of you will probably scream bloody murder when I confess this. But no...I did not order any cheesecake either visit. The main reason being is I&#39;m not much of a dessert guy. And even when I am, it&#39;s WAY after the fact. The thing is I just genuinely get way too full to consider dessert immediately after dinner. I mean...who, over the age of 12 that isn&#39;t female, eats dessert *immediately* after dinner? Really. Guys...my metabolism isn&#39;t what it used to be.<br><br>The ultimate takeaway from all this is simple: if you happen to be in a town or near a town that has a Cheesecake Factory in it, you are absolutely CRAZY not to go! They pretty much never miss the mark when it comes to the actual recipes. The only thing that could ruin your experience would be if you got subpar service. So stop on by! It will change your life. I&#39;m giving The Cheesecake Factory in the land of enchantment 4 big juicy scampi shrimp with no burnt pieces out of 5.

It was a good experience as always. Got meatloaf and it was great - my most favorite dish. Taste is consistent across their national restaurants and encounters which is good and kinda weird at the same time. Cheesecake is good though.

Never fails to please this happy yelper!! <br><br>Always brace yourselves for a long period of waiting if you come during the lunch rush and ESPECIALLY dinner!! I was worried about getting a table for 2 when we got there a lil after 6pm.  My husband hates a long wait and i was craving their thai lettuce wraps again for the longest time.  To my luck, only a 30 to 40 min wait! As long as it wasnt an hour or more, he was willing to wait lol. Yay me!<br><br>My ultimate weakness and what i diet for.... THE BREAD BASKET!! Ugh i could live off their bread and butter basket.  They always have a honey oat and white option and i love tearing into the honey oat.  Luckily its only half the basket so i dont become a complete gluton before my actual meal comes thru.  <br><br>I always order the thai lettuce wraps and the small plate of chicken somosas.  I just cannot imagine it any other way!! Thru the years, i have tried a bunch of other options. Of course its impossible to try them all but something about the healthy choice and AMAZING flavors from these wraps that just bewitched me! And those somosas? If even my husband goes for it and yet he hates curry usually, then you got something worth while! Lol. He always has a hard time ordering stuff since he is a menu price Nazi, but he ended up choosing the French Dip with sweet potatoe fries. He was actually impressed! hallelujah! Lol <br><br>And the cheesecakes? Need i say more? Lol the only thing i suggest is order from the front counter. The slices you can get to go from there seem way bigger than ordering from the table.  Either way you do it, quality is top notch!<br><br>Service is always great because thats whats expected of their staff.  I only had a few problems over the dozen times coming here so there&#39;s always a few bad apples.  Other than that, truly a worth while experience coming here.  Whether you&#39;re feeling fancy or just casual, this factory welcomes all!

I get to the Points! Horrible! Pasta hard and mushy (stick to your teeth when you bite in it) Tasteless Jambalaya Pasta and Evelyn&#39;s Favorite pasta.  Both taste like someone forgot to put sauce in the pasta compare to CheeseCake Factory in BHM, AL.  Asked for the Kitchen Manager but server just would not get him or her because he was BUSY.  They just lost my vote and more when it comes to suggestion for where to eat with the ladies.  I would not suggest this restaurant because there are much more better restaurants out there and it does not cost you a fortune to have good pasta.  Mine you, the Jambalaya Pasta was US$19.99.

Cheesecake Factory keeps getting cheaper and cheaper. In past years, half price cheesecake used to be a weekend. Then, they became more strict about having both people there in order to carry out (even though my mom was tired from walking and was sitting on a bench outside and they wouldn&#39;t accept it). Today, my dad drove all the way over to the Factory, only to be turned away and cheesecake-less

Third time&#39;s a charm? Maybe not. The food (bruleed French toast) was ok at best, so that means overall the food I&#39;ve received at this location has been decidedly &#34;meh&#34;. More curious, we arrived at opening, and with very few customers inside, our party of 8 was refused indoor dining and we were relegated to the patio, even though plenty of seating inside was available. (Wasn&#39;t an issue with reservations because we were told no Mother&#39;s Day reservations were being taken. Confusing to say the least.) <br><br>So yeah, last time here I think.

Its four normal restuarant chain. Their menu is somewhat intense and at times overwhelming but if you&#39;re dining with a big and picky group, this is the place. The servings are great for sharing or lunch the next day. I love this place for brunch but they do pack up fast so get there early. Their drink menu is okay but I do like their mimosas. And of course you can&#39;t forget their namesake. They have almost all cheesecake you can imagine. The service seems to be hot or miss when you go but I will say they are fast.

This was my first visit, a friend took me for some cheesecake we had planned on taking out. The staff heard it was my birthday and insisted I sit down so the staff could sing me Happy birthday! I was in a wheelchair and had no trouble moving around and getting a comfortable spot. I had the Carmel pecan turtle cheesecake! So creamy and good! There presentation was great ! It came on a plate with happy birthday written in chocolate! The staff was so friendly and helpful and did a good job! Thanks everyone! I had a unexpected good time!

I haven&#39;t dined in here but stopped to get some cheesecake. During the week day when I went, it wasn&#39;t overly crowded and I got my slices of cheesecake really quickly. Only getting a four because Cheesecake Factory is so wrong for their overly priced cheesecake (but they know it is sooo good).

Anniversary Day. We had to do it again. This time Covid style! It was still so good and fresh. They made it easy curbside! Thanks for the complimentary bread! Chicken and biscuits were super good with the Mac and cheese burger and the green chili cheese burger!

My mom and I went shopping at the mall. We decided to come to Cheesecake Factory . We sat in Alexis R. area and she was a very friendly &amp; attentive server. <br><br>Thank you for the enjoyable experience Alexis!!!

There was 5 of us in this Busy Restaurant. Restaurant appeared clean and nice staff was friendly.Each of us ordered Different food items from the menu ranging from pasta to enchiladas to Pizza....all food items were nastyyyy! We filled up on the bread and butter that they served us. <br>Overpriced not good food Stick to Cheesecake aka Cheesecake Factory which we didn&#39;t even get to due to the disappointment <br>Menu needs pictures Food needs to taste Better.<br>Staff and establishment was fine.

Behind any fantastic business is stellar management and top notch customer service. That couldn&#39;t be more true of the manager, Kalani, at this location. The amazing service he provided our group of 12 this Mother&#39;s Day morning will never be forgotten.  He is without a doubt the example of what management should be!  <br>Thank you so much Kalani for being a bright light and making our Mom&#39;s day!!!!

Favorite pasta place in albuquerque for sure. Although a little pricey, the experience is more than worth it. The servers are always nice and on top of it, there&#39;s complimentary bread and butter, and of course the cheesecake is to die for! It&#39;s always packed on the weekends but come for brunch saturday/sunday mornings!! they have great stuff

If I could give this a zero I would. Ordered online and was told to pick up in 25 minutes. It took 50 minutes to pick up our food. We ate. Food was incorrect and subpar. This is not the first time this has happened at this location. Food was missing ingredients and gave both me and my boyfriend horrible stomach aches. I will not be eating here again. I have only had one good meal here ever and all the others have been very mediocre for a high price tag. This meal tonight was downright horrible.

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory once before when I traveled to Denver as a child. I remember loving the atmosphere and feeling like a little kid in a candy shop. Fast forward to present day as an adult a lot has changed. The overall decore and set up is pleasing but it does not match the food at all. We had a very delightful server who was prompt and efficient. When I saw the menu pricing I understood because the restaurant screams fancy. I ordered the lunch portion bbq chicken salad at a price of $16.00. I felt that was a bit pricey for a lunch salad but I figured it would be nice. It was a decent size and the flavor was okay but i felt I could have gotten the same salad at a fast food restaurant. My boyfriend got the Chicken Picatta and it had a wonderful flavor and the chicken was cooked well. It just wasn&#39;t anything too special. We shared the banana cheesecake as a dessert  and it was very tasty and I liked that it also came with fresh bananas. It was my favorite part of the lunch but that&#39;s expected with the name of the restaurant. Overall the experience was okay but I felt it was overpriced for what we got. It will be hard for me to return in the future.

We went in for lunch today (a Monday) and thankfully there was no wait but the place was crowded.  They happily accommodated my dietary needs (no gluten or dairy) and my food was pretty good. I had the lemon roast chicken.  Our waitperson said she told the manager my issues and he modified my plate himself, which I appreciated.    My decaf coffee was on the cold side but figured after my million questions and quirks I&#39;d cut the waitstaff some slack.  My companions loved their food, pasta dishes.  Of course someone in our group finished with cheesecake, Mango Lime, which they said was lighter than they expected and really good.  They don&#39;t take reservations so be prepared to wait during busier times.  This place gets really busy.

I&#39;ve eaten here a variety of times. The reason what keeps me coming back is the variety of plates they offer and how delicious their food is. This time my boyfriend and I ordered &#34;chicken samosas&#34; off the skinny menu. They were seasoned chicken wrapped in a freshly fried crispy wonton served with a cilantro dipping sauce. So good! <br><br>As for entrees we always like to try something different. I ordered the fried shrimp platter and my shrimp were butterflied, lightly breaded and perfectly crispy. They were not greasy and were the BEST FRIED SHRIMP I&#39;ve ever had! It came with a garlic tarter sauce, yum! The fries however were dry and over salted. <br><br>My boyfriend ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich. It came with marinara and he upgraded to sweet potato fries. He was in heaven and once I took a bite of his sandwich so was I! His sweet potato fries were even saltier than mine he didn&#39;t even eat them. They were salt with a side of fries. <br><br>Every time we&#39;ve been here, the service sucks! On our first date ever we came here and sat on the patio. We had an older man who made us feel like a nuisance. This time we had a middle aged woman who was really slow. She also checked on the table across from us way more than us and we felt slightly neglected. As a server, I know it can get stressful but there was barely anyone in the restaurant. And there&#39;s a way to handle things even when you can&#39;t handle it yourself. <br><br>If this place had better service it would of gotten 5 stars. (And no salty fries)

A little late on the review, went here recently for dinner, as always the food was great! Service was good, seemed rushed but we sort of laughed it off, still very enjoyable visit. I love the Skinnylicious menu, my goal is to try all of the options. Got the steak medallions with yummy sauce, mushrooms, asparagus and a little serving of mashed potatoes underneath. Perfect pairing and a decent portion for the reduced calories option. Loved it! My dinner date had a burger with sweet potato fries, which I sampled, super yummy!

I&#39;m pretty picky when giving 5 star reviews to any place I buy food from. This place, the food and the service deserve 5 stars. Alot of the past reviews I&#39;ve done on food has been just myself. Now most everything will include myself and my woman&#39;s experience as well. Since this was our first actual date, I was hoping everything would be perfect or at least close to it. When we walked in we were told 20-25 minutes on a table. I think it was 18 minutes and the little buzzer thing went off. We were sat, got bread which was good, ordered an appetizer which was good (fried potato something), and ordered our food. She had the orange chicken which I tried and it was amazing for both of us. I ordered the bacon cheddar burger (I think that&#39;s what it was called) and i have to say it was a pretty amazing burger. The place was pretty busy and our food still got to us in a reasonable amount of time. Considering we were talking and whatnot anyways, it was good timing. ALWAYS have to get a piece of cheesecake to go on the way out. We picked out peanut butter and chocolate something. Not the reeces, but a different one. Best cheesecake ever. We will definitely be back and I think both of us are going to try something different on the menu each time we go. Thanks for the great experience.

We called ahead to see if we needed a reservation. THEY SAID, oh no it&#39;s fine etc anyway we get there, 20 min wait, with 3 tired children  , we&#39;re a party of 6, 3 adults 3 squirmy  hungry small kids. You think the waiter woul have noticed the crying children. Food was great, place was fine, .. my 1st time there, I thought the service could have been a lot better,come on now , server not ever deal with a table with kids , you could have noticed the stress at the table. Be more aware, and give service to the poor parents .

The Cheesecake Factory lives up to its expectations as always, exceptional corporate food and definitely is a standout to me in comparison to all the other corporate chains that I will not  frequent, but The Cheesecake Factory is the only one that is always my exception. Fresh Food, Friendly Service and modern swanky decor. <br><br>Anthony our server was friendly &amp; attentive, and yes it was the the Opening day and it was very hectic. I know some people were frustrated about the service and wanna complain about this &amp; that but this a fresh newly opened business and when people who dont even bring there &#34;A&#34; game from appropriate attire, to manners, to proper vocabulary....... have some couth..... and some respect as they are working through the kinks but most important stimulating our economy in the Q.<br><br>Avocado Egg Rolls is always a must and but of course a slice or two of Cheesecake LVE has me every time.

Cheesecake Factory, what&#39;s in a name....in this case exactly as it appears.  You come here for stellar cheesecake but when it comes to anything else it really feels like a factory.  People go in and out as quickly as they can seat them, feed them and say have a good day.<br><br>When we can&#39;t decide on anything to eat and we&#39;re starving, we pick Cheesecake factory.  We go in know it&#39;s going to be loud, friendly, mediocre food, in a quick amount of time.  I can&#39;t say a particular dish sticks out, nothing on my &#34;must have&#34; but I know whatever I get here will be good.<br><br>I can&#39;t say there is anything great or anything horrible, it really is just a-ok.  You&#39;ll appreciate how it connects to the mall so you can walk off the 1000+ calories consumed.
They are good service and nice place <br>We ordered Thai letters wrap, pepperoni pizza, pineapple shrimp....<br>Everything taste is really good .
I love going here for the Skinnylicious options! Highly recommend the Steak Medallions, Lemon Garlic Shrimp, and the Tuscon Chicken!

Yuck.  It was busy but waited Forever.  The lasagna was cold and really lousy.  They were shooting for a fancy version of a classic and blew it.  Bland, at best.  Daughter wouldn&#39;t send it back but it sure did not get eaten...  The spaghetti with chicken parm was plated sloppily, Georgia Peach drink was watery, coffee was Burned! and our waitress was so hurried flipping tables she picked up the tab next to us, looked right at me and never offered a warmer or refill.  Poor service about clearing plates.       <br><br>Great decor, good cheesecake. Next time do take out cheesecake only.
The chicken Parmesan pizza style is literally a huge mashed up chicken deep fried after it&#39;s been frozen is what it tasted like. Would not recommend getting anything with chicken from here

So sad, use to love this place, I was there the first day it opened and I&#39;ve always tried to support it, this time it was awful, I tried calling hours before, knowing about the whole &#34;covid&#34; so with that in mind I called, like I said before, I asked what kind of wait do you guys usually have, the person on the phone said between 30 minutes to 45 minutes, I thought It would not be a problem... so I took my family, when We get there the hostess tells me &#34;it&#39;s going to be 2 hours&#34; so as you may imagine I was really disappointed, and this is not even the issue, the problems was their terrible attitude and rude service from the hostess, even at that point I said ok we will see if it&#39;s a little faster and we will go ahead and get out name in the list.... we walked around the mall for about 30 minutes and I came back to check, they tell me, in a rude way, you&#39;ve only been waiting 30 minutes and we told you 2 and a half hours... I was like what you said 2 hours! So we just left... right at the hour (by now we have left to farina) they send me a text saying your table is ready.... I mean the hostess should be able to say wether you have an hour or 2 and a half hours!!! Terrible!! I don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll comeback

The highlight here: KFC.<br>No, not Kentucky Fried Chicken. Korean Fried Cauliflower!<br>At a whopping 1,000+ calories, this small bites plate (about the size of two handfuls) might kill your diet, but not your happiness! Crispy, savory, and flavorful all-in-all. It even won the heart of my sister, who despises cauliflower.<br><br>Most of the entrée plates here are on the pricier side, but worth the portion, IMO. However, on my most recent visits, I&#39;ve been sticking to the appetizers and shareable plates, as the complimentary bread/butter is rather filling.<br><br>The service here is either decent or iffy, depending on the day of week and time of day you&#39;re dining I guess. I came here with my family (party of 4) a while ago on Sunday night, and we had to wait so long for our entrees that we needed to flag down our waitress, who said the food was apparently sent to the wrong table. Returned with a friend a couple months later during a weekday afternoon, and we were in and out within an hour. <br><br>I&#39;m certainly not one who would spend around $7 on a single slice of Cheesecake, but my boyfriend has unashamedly done so many times here. As their signature (hence the chain&#39;s name), they were admittedly quite tasty. I did enjoy the tiramisu cheesecake, but it didn&#39;t blow my mind, to be worth that price tag, and for such a small slice.<br><br>I will, however, return for that yummy cauliflower!
Pretty good meal for a chain restaurant.  We were happy with the servers.  The food was above average.  Burgers, pasta, crab dip and salad.  All pretty good.  To full for cheesecake in the end.

I typically always eat here for lunch or happy hour. Local beers and wine and many mixed drinks to choose from. They offer bread before the meal and have a wide variety menu. Obviously their cheesecake is fantastic. This location is in the Coronado mall so it&#39;s nice to work up an appetite while shopping then enjoy a nice meal afterwards.

Ok, so Cheesecake Factory is one of the big chain restaurants I really like nowadays.  I know it gets busy, but the food and desserts are pretty darn good with 5 million choices as well.<br><br>I came here on a Saturday night with a friend.  We had a 15 minute wait to be seated, not bad for a Saturday night at 6:30.  The first thing the waitress did when she came to the table was say how busy it was, and she looked incredibly flustered.  Um, I&#39;m sorry, any other Cheesecake Factory, this would be considered slow.<br><br>When we ordered, my friend asked if she could keep the menu to look at it for desserts.  The waitress was really pushy saying she wanted it back.  She did let us keep it for a little bit while waiting for her to come back in a few minutes.  When she did come back, she twice asked, &#34;Can I have the menu now?&#34; in a very annoyed tone.  I responded &#34;yes&#34; twice, but she didn&#39;t acknowledge me.  When I looked up, she was giving my friend a death stare and waiting for her to say &#34;yes.&#34;  Apparently, I didn&#39;t count.<br><br>I asked for more sourdough bread, which took a while to come out, and she dropped it on the table and quickly walked away.  We didn&#39;t even have a chance to ask for more butter.  Really?  You don&#39;t bring bread and butter?<br><br>The rest of our time there wasn&#39;t as annoying, but if I ever have this person as a waitress again, I&#39;m asking for someone else.  Good thing Cheesecake Factory has a bunch of stuff I like, or I definitely wouldn&#39;t be back.

Honestly? The best portion of the meal whenever we go to Cheesecake Factory is the appetizer, particularly the delicious nachos they have there. Otherwise, it&#39;s a jack of all trades master of none. They&#39;ve got a gigantic menu, but nothing really stands out. <br><br>Great atmosphere and nice to sit there occasionally, but not a place we frequent.

And NOW some of you are realizing the truth about Cheesecake Factory-it really isn&#39;t good food!  And their cheesecakes aren&#39;t great either...I much preferred Dee&#39;s and sadly it&#39;s gone.  Too crowded and wait times are long, menu- although lots of items- has no standout item.

Went for an early dinner to avoid the crowds around 3pm. It wasn&#39;t that busy and it took about 10 min still to get a table. Our waitress was very polite and was there to answer any questions concerning food allergies of one of our guests. She also gave other recommendations to try and brought us fresh bread. The prices are a little high but the portions depending on the item are large. I got the chicken parmesan pizza it was massive but delicious. I need to visit again to try the many cheesecakes.

We tried to  call ahead and would not take reservations for a party of 10. When we got there the restaurant was not  that busy and they quoted us a 2 hour wait. We asked to split our table up with 2 booths and they said they would not do that. The hostess was rude about the whole situation.

I went to cheesecake factory in New Mexico (Albuquerque) with my management for lunch.<br><br>We ordered Thai lettuce wrap , bbq ranch chicken salad ,chipotle chicken pasta and davinci pasta.<br><br>Review :<br><br>Thai lettuce wrap: All the lettuce was dried and dirty. When we mentioned to server about lettuce condition and she brought us 2 piece of lettuces. We have more than 3 people... hello? <br><br>Bbq ranch chicken salad: It comes with the deep fried onion on top , but i found little piece of calamari and few piece of french fries with the deep fried onions.<br>We  mentioned to our server and she said it happens sometimes.. just like sonic how they cook deep fries all mixed together. (HUH?)<br>How can she compare to Sonic (fast food place) and cheesecake factory (restaurant)like that?<br><br>I&#39;m not a chef , but i have a common sense.<br>I know they deep fried stuffs in same fryer, but before they deep fried stuffs they need to remove all the pieces from previous time. It was disgusting how she handle customers.<br><br>Davinci pasta: This is one of my favorite pasta from cheesecake . It came out watery , mushroom wasn&#39;t fully cooked  and no caramelized the onion as well.<br>Manager reached out to us. She says this is how exactly looks like .. we told her pasta sauce suppose to be dark color and she said dinner time restaursnt lights are dark and that&#39;s why pasta color looks dark at night time. I had this pasta day time and night time. I know better!!  I was very speechless  about what she told us. She did not handled the problem in kitchen professionally  as a manager  and rude. The way she look at us I felt  discriminated from her. Because we are asian and hispanic?<br>I will not go there ever again.

Foods are good enough but feels like customer service gets worse bit by bit every time. <br><br>It wasn&#39;t busy but I had to wait awhile to be seated and awhile to get my order placed.<br><br>I constantly had to ask for items when I hadn&#39;t need to before and server never bothered to check up on us for unless it was really obvious that we were trying to get ahold of her. She had no issue checking up on other customers so not sure if she was actually busy or not.<br><br>Food portion gets smaller as well while price stays same or so (I almost always gets a pasta, no seafood or any special expensive ingredients... so unless price of flour is jumping up every month... I kind of expect portion to stay about same).<br>Pasta I ordered tasted really, really bland this time compare to before which was very disappointing.<br><br>Extra star because breads taste really good (it was only thing I enjoyed this time).
Got a 100.00 dollar gift certificate and received 4 cheese certificates back for every 25.00 you spend. IIn all reality spent 60.00.

I would say that the bread is the best part of the experience at Cheesecake Factory! The service, while providing human contact, does not do much more than that. Not only were we not provided with silverware, but we didn&#39;t even get our food till after all of the tables around us, even the ones that had been seated after us. After we got our food, we had to return it due to the noodles not being fully cooked. I&#39;ve never experienced such horrible service at other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, I wouldn&#39;t recommend eating here.

We went to have lunch on our one hour lunch break. We sat at the bar thinking it would be fast service, the bar had no one sitting at it yet. It took a while for the bartender to show up and take our drink order. Then a little more Time to get our food order. Then forever for the kitchen to prepare the food.<br>We ended up taking our food to go and eating it in the car. Not a good experience.<br>Obviously, the dining experience sucked.<br>Food quality was so-so.<br><br>They did not offer a discount or anything else.

I give it a 3 and half stars.<br>Atmosphere: Good:<br>Not too many people, nice lighting with big lamp looking things coming from the ceiling, and the way the booths are set up makes the seating very intimate.<br>Food: Good<br>The taste of the entree was decent, but like I said, it felt like it was missing something.  Steak was succulent, mashed potatoes were chunky, the sauce was a little too much salt, and the onions for some reason were hard to eat. The Caramel Cheesecake on the other hand was off-the-hook, lots of layers of flavor and wonderful texture. It is an art form.<br>Price: Not Great<br>Even though you get a big portion size, and you can most likely have a meal or two (or three) I feel like that should be an option. Maybe ask if we would like like a half portion as well for us that don&#39;t want to spend $20 on a plate of spaghetti, when we might as get a damn steak.<br>-Desert Breeze

The service isn&#39;t that great. As we were being seated at our table there was a hair on the table and as I mentioned it to the hostess she just wiped it off with her hand and walked away. Our waitress was very nice yet she didn&#39;t give us any refills or did she check on us at all. My food came out first and my husbands food came out 5 mins laters first his club sandwich then 10mins later he got his French fries. For being such a big and busy business you would figure that the restroom would be a lot more accommodating. I waited in line to use the restroom ‍. Not impressed at all for the price we paid!!
Cheesecake factory is a chain restaurant that has promising arrays of delectable burgers, padta, some Asian flares and of course, large amount of variety of desserts

I don&#39;t even like chain restaurants (normally) and try to support the little guy, but every time I go here I have a good experience. Good service. Good food. Love the kale with grilled salmon salad. So good, and fresh! Some of the cheesecakes flavors really have too much going on, but I am always happy when I order the plain with fresh strawberries.

Oh the irony of coming to such a wonderful restaurant and not partaking in the item that it receives its name (but maybe sometime soon!). This establishment has extremely fast service and friendly staff, even with may patrons eating Sunday brunch and lunch. The opening act is the bread, which is well worth all the hype that surrounds. As for the overall atmosphere, the layout moves with the restaurant&#39;s design and the lighting compliments the interior decor nicely. The food is rather pleasant considering the sheer number of items that are available. All in all, The Cheesecake Factory is a very solid restaurant which only makes me want to come back again to indulge in the showstopping desserts!
Only tried the cheesecake. Raspberry lemon and the strawberry were unbelievable..and so was the bill. Be ready to splurge, for both calories and the wallet!

I felt obligated to write a review about this Cheesecake Factory, because I feel like its current ratings are nowhere close to the experience that I had.  I tried the stuffed mushrooms, and it was one of the best! The steak diane was good, and the chicken madeira was even better. And you can&#39;t leave Cheesecake Factory without some cheesecake! Even though I was already full, the classic strawberry cheesecake didn&#39;t stand a chance.  They really do have the best cheesecake! The service was also good, despite there being so many people during dinner time.

Just like other quality Cheesecake Factories around the country. I&#39;m certainly impressed with the high standards this place offers on a consistent basis. It&#39;s never failing and ever strong. <br>I love their Long Island ice teas. And avocado egg roll thingys. <br>I love the chicken biscuits, despite its overwhelming white people taste. My little guy loved it too. <br>The service was exceptional as always. These guys are trained beyond your imagination could ....imagine. <br>I love the rye bread and butter. Don&#39;t forget you need a pad of butter per piece of bread. <br>You can not go wrong with dessert. Move out da way Flying Star. Cheesecake Factory still has THE BEST dessert.

Love the Cheesecake Factory! Usually like to visit local places, but the Cheesecake Factory is a treat. I&#39;ve only experienced good service at this location. One time my husband was given the wrong dish and they immediately brought out the correct one and let us keep the extra meal. I really love the bistro shrimp pasta and the chipotle pasta. The fried Mac and cheese is really tasty but a little pricey because you only get 2 pieces and it costs around $11. Of course the cheese cake is tasty too. We usually need to get it to go. My go to is the s&#39;mores... yum!

My family and I went here for my birthday. My son had spaghetti and meatballs, my husband and I shared the chicken and shrimp gumbo with brown rice. <br><br>It was really delicious and perfectly spicy. <br><br>I ordered a pineapple Moscow mule that tasted like juice, I couldn&#39;t taste the vodka at all. It had very little.<br><br>For dessert my son had the red velvet cheesecake, my husband had the salted caramel cheesecake and I had the &#34;ultrarageous Chris&#34; cheesecake. My son and I couldn&#39;t finish our cheesecakes, they were really rich and quite overwhelming. Next time we are going to try the plain one. <br><br>A little bit pricey but it was worth.
Waiting two hours for any meal is not a pleasant experience. You might just want to eat<br> before you go.

Came out for an evening meal with my partner to one of my favorites restaurants the Cheesecake Factory which did not disappoint. I ordered the herb crusted filet of salmon and Despite the spider like appearance it&#39;s amazing!

Let me just start with the service; slow and indifferent to the the fact that were even there. I ordered a glass of wine, but never got it. Halfway thru our meal, the waitress came back with the excuse that the bartender was slammed. Why wasn&#39;t management stepping in to help? He was too busy getting cozy with his staff to make sure things were running as they should. To top things off, we forgot a cell phone on the table. As soon as we realized it, we went back (20 minutes max), they had given to someone else!!! We never did get it back. Our experience didn&#39;t end there; the manager (same one) accused us of being irresponsible for leaving it in the first place. Instead of trying to help, he called security. We&#39;ll never go back. The food is not enough to overcome rotten/indifferent service.

Service: we sat at the bar area, which is a fCFS deal. However our server was awesome!!!! So sweet and made sure that we were happy!<br><br>Food: my sister and I shared the chicken Marsala! Holy cow it was delicious! There was for sure enough to share with two adults! Everything was great!

The DISHES were disgustingly DIRTY. The first two cups had a nasty red sauce on the handle and on the bottom of the cups, both of them. With a few bits of food around the rim. We asked for new cups. She brought back two more cups which still had food gunk stuck to it. One even had something like spinach stuck to the rim. The silverware? Forget about it. They were sticky with food particles caked onto them. Did they even run them through the dish washer? We asked for plastic silverware to eat with. I didn&#39;t want to keep sending the waitress back. Check out the photos.<br><br>When we spoke to the manager about it, he seemed to not care at all. He was very &#34;as if&#34; about it. So, no help from him. He rolled his eyes as we left the restaurant. <br><br>I usually love this chain but the Albuquerque one is the worst I have ever been to. I&#39;ve been to 6 different ones in different states. It&#39;s usually my go to. I&#39;ll never go back to the Albuquerque chain. Gross!

There are lots of flavors of these cheesecakes that they have at the &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; alright. Including Low Carb, Strawberry, Chocolate, Salted Caramel, Oreo, Lemon, Cherry, Blueberry, and others.

We went on our first date night in a LONG time and decided to visit The Cheesecake Factory. We were greeted by our server who rushed to get our order in to make the happy hour prices! The food was incredible and the prices were even better. I would definitely recommend their happy hour to anyone! Great food and drinks at great prices!

I&#39;m gonna go against the grain here and say the Cheesecake Factory is awesome. I&#39;ve been to the Albuquerque location a few times, but as a well-seasoned patron in other states, this is one of the better locations. We love coming here for appetizers and/or desserts and the service has been superb every time we&#39;ve been here. <br><br>Recently, I tried the Apple Crisp which was perfect in my book! The &#34;crisp&#34; is more like cobbler served with warm, cinnamon-y apples and ice cold vanilla ice cream. Thanksgiving is around the corner and I could eat this everyday (Fall is here!). This last Friday we sat at the bar. The lady and gentleman who were there were personable and fun!<br><br>You may wonder why people love eating here, when there are so many other amazing restaurants that rock Albuquerque. It&#39;s the perfect combination of service, location, variety, and setting. The menu is large, but that works for big groups. The plates are generic enough, there&#39;s nothing you can turn down...no... not even the cheesecake!

Was our first time eating here today. The experience was great and the atmosphere was was very welcoming. We had our baby in a carrier/stroller they placed us very conveniently to the washroom and away from others to enjoy their lunch because our baby can be fussy. We ordered the Louisiana pasta and Steak Dianna ( I think that&#39;s the steak was called) and wings for appetizer. The waitress was very polite and tentative. Was a great experience for us.

Well we finally tried the cheesecake factory. I&#39;ve been wanting to try this for some time but just never have. while we were on vacation in NM my step-mother treated us to this restaurant. Although we had kinda a difficult time finding this location we eventually did, its in the back of the mall. <br>We went in a Thursday evening around 9pm and we still had a wait. One thing that is nice is if you are able to use a smartphone you can pull up their whole menu online so you already have an idea of what you want when you are seated.<br>We were greeted in a timely manner which I always appreciate.<br>the menu ranges from what I could tell is from $12-30, and there are plenty of apps to choose from. <br>They offer several entrée selections that include but not limited to pasta, steaks , seafood, and salads.<br>I had a ribeye steak for dinner which honestly was cooked like I asked and had a great flavor. <br>My Father opted for the Hibachi steak which he also enjoyed and both our meals came with mashed potatoes and vegetables.<br>My Wife and Stepmother both opted for pasta dishes which were served with fresh grated parmesan cheese, my Son the fried shrimp platter which he didn&#39;t choose to offer me a sample but informed me they were delicious, lol.  and they did look like a nice size of shrimp.<br>All in all we all enjoyed our meals, the only thing we regret is we were all so tired from a day of shopping in Sante fe we didn&#39;t try the cheesecake or other desserts. So that will be on our &#34;bucket list&#34; when we get back to Denver. <br>So I will recommend this location and stay tuned for our review about Denver&#39;s Cheesecake Factory!!

This is a great place to stop by for drinks before shopping, which is great because I don&#39;t know of any options within the mall. This is a standard cheesecake factory which for ABQ is super high end.

First of all, I NEVER had to write a bad review, anyways  I took my boyfriend for his birthday this evening, and we approached the hostess  and told her we will be a party of 16 and the  first thing she says is &#34;Are you serious?&#34; And rolled her eyes. Like seriously? I was so disappointed and angry the way they talked to us like we were such a bother and at that point I  really wish we could of gone somewhere else but  we couldn&#39;t because we had  already told our party about eating here. The food was good and our server was great. Our friends really enjoyed dinner other than that, but my goodness they definitely need to hire more professional hostesses. I can&#39;t believe how rude they were to my boyfriend. I hope they don&#39;t treat all customers this way.
Came in for Sunday brunch and it was perfect! The waiter was attentive and kind. The food and the drinks were also great. Make sure to ask for fresh grated Parmesan on your food.

We usually eat here when we come to Albuquerque and enjoy the experience. Tonight however, we came in at 945 pm, they don&#39;t close until 11pm. They were not busy but it took too long to be waited on for our food order it was 50 minutes before the waitress took our food order. It took forever to get a refill on my drink, the waitress was upset because we wanted lemon for my wife&#39;s tea, and we had to call her over several times as she would check on the table across from us and would not check on us. <br><br>The first time we ate here we had a bad waiter but he was better than tonight, by far. My wife&#39;s food was good she said but my steak was somewhat over cooked. I ate it anyway because I didn&#39;t want to wait for them to recook it. Very disappointed with this visit.

I love coming to this restaurant! Besides Pappadeaux this is one of my hands down favorite places to go. Tons of menu options everything you could imagine for the whole family so everyone will be happy. The food is good quality with big portions for you big eaters like myself. I&#39;m lactose intolerant so my allergy to dairy is always something I&#39;m concerned about and my server Nico made sure that all my food was cooked with olive oil instead of butter. Even went back to the kitchen and triple checked for me when I was unsure just because I&#39;ve had a lot of bad experiences at restaurants with the servers just not really caring before, but he made me feel comfortable and confident that I&#39;d be fine. I started with the fire grilled artichoke which is my favorite appetizer especially with that mayo dipping sauce. The salmon was great and my friend loved his factory burrito. My drink was a whiskey martini hybrid mixed with some honey for a light refreshing taste. You can tell the people that work here really enjoy their job which makes the experience of being served my happy people that much better.
Had the worst customer service here. We got seated pretty quickly but then everything else took forever. The server was all over the place. It was a nightmare. Never going to this place again.

Takeout order review:<br>-Lemon Meringue Cheesecake: Yum!<br>-Sunday Brunch Chicken &amp; Waffles Benedict:  Waste of money! Flavorless. Small portion. Chicken tenders rather than whole portion chicken. And they forgot the syrup! <br>-Mashed Potatoes:  Good.<br>Results: Go for the cheesecake only. Overpriced, under-flavored everything else. This is our third visit. We wanted to love it. We&#39;re done w/the place.

50 minutes to get our food. 10 minutes to get our drinks. Waiter was nice but we had no idea what he was saying. He talked low and mumbled. My food and wife&#39;s was pretty good once we got it. The kid&#39;s was disgusting. Corn dogs had no flavor and mac and cheese was watered down cheese powder that had solidified.  Also no flavor, I felt bad getting upset with him for not wanting to eat it until I tried it. Worst mac and cheese ever. <br>Horrible service, never got water refills, took long getting food/drink, ants were all over the patio under our table, not once did we see a manager walk by to check on anyone.  I&#39;ve been to many other CFs around country (3rd time at this location) and this one is the worst i personally have seen.  Way to go Albuquerque. Corporate needs to come in and retrain and do an overhaul on this place.

This place is absolutely fantastic! The food selection, the drinks, the Happy Hour menu, and, of course, the desserts! To top it off, the atmosphere is lively. My husband and I love the bar area. This place is super popular and, therefore, super busy on the weekends so expect to wait. It&#39;s worth it!<br><br>Recommendations:<br>* Tamale corn cakes (appetizer)<br>*Avocado eggrolls (appetizer)

Who knew this place served more than just cheesecake! ?!!  What a fun and hip place to eat while enjoying the company of  family and friends.  Everyone was genuinely happy to help and work.   Loved the music and the decor. <br><br>It was non stop from the time we arrived to the time we left.  Not a whole lot of space to sit and wait for extended periods but the buzzers have a pretty decent range so you can check out  near by shops as you wait.  We were fortunate enough to snag a bar table which was a major SCORE!   Our waitress Katie was very sweet and made our experience well worth the wait. <br><br>I had the pleasure of eating the avocado eggrolls, Cajun Jumbolya along with a Cosmo what a treat! Kaluha cheese cake to go please it&#39;s a wrap!

Our first time here, meeting friends for lunch. The five of us were seated immediately in the large, open, nicely decorated restaurant and given baskets of different breads and butter. Looking through the expansive menu, And the additional other lunch? menu, I ordered the green chile Cheeseburger with French fries. I asked for the condiments on the side and mid rare. The cheeseburger arrived with some, what looked like pico de gallo and slivers of something crunchy, and a small dish of jalapenos and ketchup for the fries. The bun was nicely toasted and the right size for the burger. I didn&#39;t taste green chile at all sadly. The burger was cooked alright. My husbands meatloaf was ok, but my friends Thai dish lacked not only flavor, but spice. I guess we should have stuck with cheesecake, seeing as that&#39;s the name of the place and both of our slices of cheesecake, my lemon raspberry and his Chocolate cherry, were the best things we tasted. For the three of us, with drinks, almost a hundred bucks. I&#39;d probably only go back for cheesecake.

At least NM now has a Cheesecake Factory.. after a long enough wait.<br><br>I&#39;ve been in twice -- once for an actual sit down meal &amp; once to pick up a slice of cheesecake (only because I was craving it).<br><br>Both times have been quite pleasant -- although the wait was quite longer than expected.<br><br>The first time I went in w/ a friend around like 430pm on a weekday... I got there first to reserve our spot in line which resulted in a 30-45min wait. I mean, it&#39;s cool because I could get in some shopping in the meantime. I came back 30-45min to get seated at a table near the bar. The waitress waiting on my table was very attentive &amp; got us our food in a reasonable amount of time. I got the mac &amp; cheese burger &amp; it was pretty filling. The amount of food you get for the price is pretty good. I also got the white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake to go &amp; that was a pretty good decision.<br><br>The second time I came in was for a cheesecake run... at like 10pm on a weekday night. I was literally the only one in the cheesecake pick up line -- but had to wait like 5min before someone actually helped me. This time, I got the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut one &amp; it&#39;s def one of my faves.<br><br>I look forward to coming back here again to try other menu items as well as other cheesecakes.

Very rarely do I give a restaurant a five star review.  Today I experienced 5 star service and 5 star food at Albuquerque&#39;s new Cheesecake Factory.  <br>We arrived at opening time,  (11:00 a.m.  Saturday morning)... <br><br>Since opening a few months ago, the location  has been overwhelmed with business and it  has been almost impossible to secure a table.<br>I was reluctant to patronize this location after having read several &#34;negative&#34;  reviews here on Yelp.  <br>But like anything else, food and service is very subjective.    My dining guest  and I decided to experience it firsthand and reach our own conclusion. <br>Given the fact they have only been open a couple of months, I expected there to be &#34;opening month&#34;  blunders and lots of them. <br>That in fact did happen.   Now that Albuquerque&#39;s  Cheesecake Factory has had a few months to find their way,  they&#39;re ready for &#34;prime time&#34;. <br><br>Bear in mind that I am one of the harshest restaurant critics on the planet earth... Having said that, I must share with you my dining  experience.  <br><br>We were greeted by a pleasant young man &#34;DANNY&#34; , our server.  He was quite knowledgeable about the menu and was personable and friendly.<br>We started with a couple of appetizers. ... Fried Zucchini and Guacamole and chips... They were delivered promptly.   What a pleasant surprise...  The Guacamole was made up of<br> giant chunks of fresh cut up avocados,  tomatoes and onions and a nice blend of spices,  unlike the usual mish mash you get at other restaurants .<br> Indeed, the best Guacamole I&#39;ve ever had in Albuquerque. <br><br>My lunch guest ordered fish and chips... I ordered their pit beef sandwich which is a roast beef au jus sandwich which came with a cup of  natural beef dipping  juices <br>and horseradish on the side. <br><br>The fish and chips were  hot and crisp served with tartar sauce.  My hot roast beef sandwich was absolutely delicious... <br>The beef was  thinly sliced, very tender and  cooked perfectly to a medium and was served with a  slice of cheese and caramelized onions on a delicious seeded roll<br>along with sweet potato fries. The portion was quite generous and filling.  The service provided by Danny was very professional and exemplary.<br>The restaurant&#39;s manager, JOHN GARCIA,   came by our table to ensure everything was satisfactory.  Indeed it was and then some.<br><br>We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Albuquerque&#39;s new Cheesecake Factory... This is a &#39;must visit&#39; .   I highly recommend it and proudly give it 5 stars !!! <br><br>Mike Santullo<br>Albuquerque,  New Mexico
Great food, great service, clean and nice. Meets all my criteria for 5 stars . Got an awesome fresh salad. Kids were happy with a quesadilla. Went home with some cheesecake.

Save your time and money and go somewhere that won&#39;t take 40 mins to serve you a cold hamburger and then forget your spouses entree. No meal should take that long at a restaurant and then come cold. To top it off we had to wait another several mins for them to bring my fiancé&#39; dish which was also cold and tasted like plastic. I&#39;m pretty sure they forgot about his plate. Now I remember why I never go to this location. Our waiter didn&#39;t even check on us. I hate bad service and here you get the bad service with the bad food. Should have known by reading all the other bad reviews. I don&#39;t recommend this place at all!! Fix your service, it&#39;s a Wednesday night it&#39;s not even busy.

The Cheesecake Factory- it&#39;s the same everywhere you go. The food is good, the cheesecake is yummy!! We had the tiramisu cheesecake, very very good!<br><br>The service- sooo slowww. Our waitress kept forgetting us, our party of 6 couldn&#39;t get a refill. We had to ask other servers for silverware, straws, refills, missing food,ect. Very disappointed with the service. <br><br>If I come back, it will be for a slice of cheesecake to go! :)

I so want to give 5 stars but it&#39;s just not possible. We decided to order to go so we called the main number to place our order. It took over 15 minutes just for someone to pick up the phone, and we were calling around 330.....so once they finally answered the phone we placed our order. <br><br>We ordered the Buffalo blasters and pot stickers for appetizers. I ordered the spicy chicken Chipotle pasta and my husband ordered the jambalaya. The girl on the phone asked if we wanted lunch or dinner portions and we ordered dinner. We ordered extra orders of bread and 2 slices of cheesecake. <br><br>The girl was fast coming out curbside with our food and was nice. Once we looked at our order though things were clearly wrong.<br><br>They did not give us the extra bread and our portions were lunch size yet they charged us for dinner size. My pasta had maybe 3 chicken nugget sized pieces of chicken. Don&#39;t get me wrong it tasted amazing but it was extremely disappointing when you pay good money for a messed up order. Clearly they need to improve curbside and correctly making orders.

This place sucks.  My friend and I went to eat tonight, we got seated right away, but it went downhill from there.  It took over ten minutes to be greeted.  Then the server shows up to take our drink order and asks us if we want bread.  Yes of course.  He goes and comes back with drinks, to then takes our order.  No bread.  He doesn&#39;t ask what I want for a side, I had to stop him to tell him.  We don&#39;t see him for about 20 minute.  Our drinks have been empty for ten, still no bread.  I talk to a manager, who is very apologetic, gets us refills and a new server.  The new server tries her best but we get our bread with just enough time to inhale it before the food shows up.  The food is fine.  Then we order cheesecake, because who doesn&#39;t there?   They don&#39;t have the cherry cheesecake anymore, WTF Cheesecake Factory?  <br><br>But then she brings the check and there are no discounts, no coupons, not even a simple dessert comp.  I sat in your damn restaurant for over an hour, with the laziest server I have ever had in my life, then you don&#39;t even give me something to make things right.  Sorry, you guys were in service recovery mode AND YOU FAILED.  You should have taken care of things and made it right.  <br><br>Never coming back.

We door dash often especially when we have company. We order from the cheesecake factory which have have done numerous times. Our order was apparently canceled for not having an item to fulfill the order. There was not any attempt for us to know which item was not available nor an attempt to ask if we wanted to replace the unavailable item. This does not seem like good customer service.  Our whole order canceled. Lost our repeat business.

Cheesecake Factory is massively hyped, usually in connection to thousand plus calorie meals. So when they came to ABQ, I gave it a month and then went twice in a week, once with the family and once with a work friend. <br><br>It was honestly better than I expected. The weekend visit with my husband and son was mixed, as we got shuttled out to a heated patio on a cold, drizzly Saturday. Service was quick, if not terribly polished. I got a burger, my husband got chicken Parm sandwich, and my son got pizza. Burger was surprisingly good, and my husband and son both demolished their lunch as well. Soda refills were sporadic, and honestly it was a half-step above Chili&#39;s. Good but not worth the work of standing in line and shivering on the side patio. <br><br>The second time was much better, on a noon lunch. My friend had the club salad and I had the ahi tuna salad. Really tasty and fresh, and we had better seats by the bar. The cheesecake is FABULOUS (it was my friend&#39;s birthday so we had to indulge!) We got a variety with caramel on top and finished very last bite. Service was better, too. <br><br>So averaging a 3 star experience with a 4.5 gives Cheesecake Factory a rounded 4 stars. I highly recommend going on an off time. Just not worth it otherwise. I don&#39;t see this becoming a regular hangout, but I won&#39;t refuse an invite.

Wife and I came on a Friday night , got a quick seat at the bar. The wait to dine in the dining area was 15-30 minutes but we got lucky at the bar. I had a la cumbre Pilsner which was tasty - I was surprised to see a few local drafts on the menu of a national chain. Wife had a lemon drop and it was a little on the sweet side but still tasty. We skipped right to dinner - i had a simple green chile cheese burger which was pretty darn good. Wife had a pineapple chicken and shrimp dish. She said it was good. We skipped on the cheesecake for dessert since we were full. The cheesecake is the whole attraction and we have had them before - all of them have been tasty. Overall, service and food were solid.

I come almost every week or at least every other week. The service is fine and I have no problem with that. But the cooking has severely declined and is getting worse and worse.
