Management was notified and accepted responsibility by offering compensation but I declined. Each visit there&#39;s something wrong to include but not limited to getting orders wrong, sides being severely delayed and come out when you&#39;re pretty much done with your plate; also the green beans aren&#39;t being cut (like every other restaurant) and have the vine still attached.

The wait was around 45 minutes, which is acceptable since it just opened. I ordered the salmon and it was delicious! Our waitress was a sweetheart and showed knowledge of the menu. I ordered the tuxedo cheesecake and I ate every last bite! I will be returning :)

To day was my birthday and I called to check the availability for eight people the said  they had seating for eight with in 20 min  so we all came and have been waiting for and hour and a half this place is horrible taking other large groups of 6 and seating the the point is I do not recommend this place and every time I would ask how long the would say ruffle 20 min the food was not that&#39;s great hate a big problem with the staff not being attentive to their paying customers  my whole birthday dinner was ruined thanks to the dumb staff working there and the reason there is one star is because that&#39;s you have to choose at least one star if I could it would be a negative

I love the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to different ones from different states. We had the warm crab and artichoke dip, salted caramel cheesecake, and tuxedo cheesecake.<br><br>First off, you can&#39;t go wrong with cheesecake. We LOVED the salted caramel and the tuxedo cheesecake.<br><br>Service was slow and just okay. The food was great.

Why do people like this place so much? It&#39;s okay, but I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth waiting 45 minutes for; well actually, I don&#39;t think any national chain is worth waiting for when you have so many great local places without a wait. Anyway, once you are eventually seated you get to sit down and read a good book; sorry I mean the menu. I think it&#39;s possible to have too many choices. Also, bring a flashlight, it gets dark at night. I love the way it is decorated, from what I could see.<br><br>The food is not bad, but if you want to feel good about yourself don&#39;t read the calories. If you are on a diet with a cheat day this visit counts as 3 cheat days, sorry! :-( The Pasta Carbonara with Chicken is so good and only 2,290 calories! To be fair, if you ask the staff for a to-go box and immediately put half of your meal in it, I guarantee you will be full and still have food for lunch tomorrow. By the way, the cheesecake is awesome.
I mean it&#39;s the cheesecake factory. The service was pretty good, and the food is ok. I mainly come for the cheesecake though. The selection of cheesecake is great.

Been here a few times and have yet to figure out why everyone says this is such a good restaurant. <br><br>Our last trip there seals the deal for why we won&#39;t be back again. Friday night, after waiting for a table we finally sit down. First, they&#39;re &#34;out of beer&#34;--something about being out of CO2.. they&#39;re also out of the artichoke appetizer. The server said it&#39;s because they got a bad shipment last month and they haven&#39;t had them since, which I then posit the question &#34;you only order fresh produce once a month?!&#34; <br><br>Ordered the crab dip appetizer and waited to order entrees. We specifically told the server we wanted to enjoy our appetizer before the entrees. Even after waiting to order entrees, our appetizer was out only 2 minutes before they flung entrees onto our table as well. I suppose that was a good thing because we had no appetizer plates and had been eating the bread using our menus as plates beforehand. Asked for another bread basket from the food runner that never arrived. Asked for more toast for the crab dip appetizer that took another 15 minutes so the dip was cold by the time that came out. <br><br>Now on to the entrees-- chicken pasta my friend ordered tasted as if they spilled a cup of sugar on top. The salad, which I had added chicken to came out with a cold leftover-looking piece of dried up chicken. So we don&#39;t cook the chicken fresh to order. Oh but they were able to microwave it up for me to dry it out even more than it already was--how swell. <br><br>At the end of our meal we asked about desserts but made sure to ask what they were out of first; which I believe it was 3 cheesecake flavors. Mentioned again how crazy it was they didn&#39;t have beer on a Friday night to our server who then said &#34;oh yeah they fixed it&#34; --Awesome, would&#39;ve been great to know that so we could&#39;ve ordered one. <br><br>The food quality is low, the servers aren&#39;t trained properly, and there&#39;s little reason to come back when with all the mishaps not one manager seemed to be on the floor putting out the fires. Not impressed.

I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factory restaurants in different states. This one I will have to say is the worse when it comes to customer service. <br><br>I called an order in for take out. Once I got there is was directed to go to the area for take out. There were 2 employees there behind the chessecake counter. They both saw me but neither one of them acknowledged me. So after a few minutes had passed. I got her attention and told her I was the re rot pick up an order. Her response was the cashier stepped away and should return soon. So after waiting again for another 10 mins. The cashier finally showed out. Since I was about 2 seconds from walking out the door. <br><br>This location needs to train their employees to acknowledge customers even if you can&#39;t help them.

I know that this is late.  My friends &amp; I came here for dinner while I was on vacation.  Everything came out just perfect,  from the wine that they served me, our dinners were perfect, even the waitstaff.  Our waiter checked on my party about 4-5 different times to see if everything was to our perfection and it was.  I have not had that type of service in along time.  I&#39;m just sorry that I can&#39;t remember our server&#39;s name.

Needed a change from the usual places we eat, and at a friend&#39;s suggestion, we met here for lunch. I appreciate an extensive menu, which this place certainly has, and with all the possibilities, ended up deciding to satisfy my craving for a bacon cheeseburger. The beef was done perfectly, and the generous portion of bacon was delicious. I really liked their unsweet tropical tea, too. The service was excellent, attentive without hovering or making us feel rushed. (Thank you, Kevin.) I tend to frequent restaurants that are a lot less noisy, but for today, having a nice long lunch on the patio worked out just fine.

First off I will say that this is my wife&#39;s favorite restaurant, and we have been several times before with great service.  So here&#39;s where it gets bad.  <br>1. Was given the mandatory pager and a 15 minute wait.  After 35 minutes I asked the hostess the status and she said she realized she gave us the wrong pager, hence reason why 6 groups were sat before our party of 3. <br>2. After being sat we waited 15 more minutes for our server Brian to get our drinks etc.  And 45 minutes for our food. <br>3. Food was horrible, and tasted like it had been reheated in a microwave.  Server messed up order 2x. <br>4. They were Out of wife&#39;s favorite dessert. (isn&#39;t this the &#34;cheesecake factory?&#34;). <br>So overall I was very upset with many aspects of this visit.  The only reason i didn&#39;t complain was that my wife didn&#39;t want me to cause a scene.... She&#39;s more compassionate having worked in the restaurant industry.

We got sitted in an area with no waiter. Once someone realize we was sitting there, 5 minute have elapsed. Once we got a waiter, the service was good. The food was okay. Could have gotten the same type of food at Applebee. The best thing about the restaurant was the cheese cake.

We love Cheesecake Factory! We come all the time! The servers are great! The green tea is fantastic! We haven&#39;t had anything on the menu that wasn&#39;t fantastic! Love the our door seating! Love their skinnylicious menu as well! They have a fabulous Brunch menu on Sundays that you DO NOT want to miss!! Over all so so glad that Cheesecake Factory is finally in Albuquerque!

$9 for a puny slice of cheesecake???  Really?  It wasn&#39;t even worth it.  Tasted like Costco cheesecake but with more sugar.  Service was okay but there was some confusion as to what we ordered so having our food getting passed back and forth from the kitchen wasn&#39;t an ideal start to eating.  Not returning.

I don&#39;t get it. The Cheesecake Factory sounded like such a great place but our experience was quite the opposite.<br>First, they say they&#39;re open late but what they really mean is that if you come in after 8p maybe you can sit at the bar and maybe someone will be willing to at least take your order at some point but don&#39;t expect drinks or bread or any of the other things you&#39;ll get in the regular dining areas.<br>So, we came in after 8p, 6 of us. The second we walked in the hostess was less than thrilled to see us and everything went downhill from there. We saw at least 4 waiters/waitresses in the area, none of which could be bothered to help the one server that was taking care of all the tables seated in the bar. Needless to say we got no refills, we had to ask for bread a couple times before we actually got some and the food was not only barely warm and tasted &#34;meh&#34;, it wasn&#39;t even correct! One in our party didn&#39;t get his entree until after the rest of us were almost finished. All of that that and then a ridiculously large bill similar to what we would have paid for a nicer dinner somewhere else in the area. I&#39;ve had the opportunity to go back but opt for other places for dinner, if I ever do go back maybe I&#39;ll just have dessert, seems to be the safest bet for my buck.

Unfortunately, after our most recent visit last night, it will probably be a while before I choose to dine in again.  <br><br>My husband and I have been here several times now, and the service has continued to be inconsistent.  There have been multiple times when, halfway through our meal, we&#39;ve been told our server is changing.  At first we thought our initial server was due to go off shift or something, but then we would continue to see our initial server serving other tables after being pulled from ours.  After about the third time this happened, we asked why, and we&#39;re given some bizarre explanation about how the servers are required to rotate sections after a certain amount of time or something.  No other restaurant I know of has such a policy, and it&#39;s confusing, especially when it comes time to tip.  Who am I tipping, the first server, the second server, both?  Granted, this does not happen every time, but I don&#39;t understand the concept.  <br><br>While the service has varied from good, to decent, to kind of lacking on previous visits, last night it was extremely lacking.  Again we had a gift certificate we wanted to use, and when we arrived we were quoted a 40 minute wait.  We were asked if we wanted inside, patio, or first available.  Normally I don&#39;t mind sitting on the patio, and will usually say first available since it can mean being seated faster, but last night it was chilly. I asked the hostess if the patio was heated (I couldn&#39;t remember) and was told yes, so we said first available.  Because of it, we were seated in about half the quoted time on the patio.  However, although it is heated, the heaters are up on the ceiling of the covered patio, and as the patio is not completely enclosed (it&#39;s open on the ends), the heaters didn&#39;t do much to combat the chill in the air.  There were additional floor heaters located OUTSIDE the peremeter of the patio, but they provided no additional heat, as the shades were closed and we were sitting by the opposite wall away from them.  We decided to stick with it because we didn&#39;t want to be put back on the list to wait for another table.  My husband went to the car to get our jackets which helped a bit.  I understand that having the additional patio seating helps with wait times, but if the restaurant can&#39;t provide adequate heat in colder weather on the patio, it shouldn&#39;t be utilized.  On top of that, the service on the patio was pretty inattentive.  Our server was very pleasant, but unfortunately not very efficient.  I&#39;m thinking he was probably having to juggle waiting tables inside as well as the patio, but the service on the patio suffered because of it.  My husband and I ordered iced teas (yes, I know I just said that we were chilly on the patio, but we like the tea here), and we were asked if we wanted bread, which of course we said yes, please.  A while later we get our teas and place our dinner orders.  The server leaves and I go to reach for the sweatener when I realize there is none on the table or any of the surrounding tables that I can see.  Our server came back with the bread some time later, and I asked for some sweetener for the tea, and the server leaves to go fetch some, or so I think, but he must have gotten sidetracked as I don&#39;t see him for a while.  Meanwhile, we have bread and butter, but no bread plates and no silverware.  We start eating it anyway and just scooping up the butter in the dish with the bread as we have no knives to spread it with.  We finish the bread, and eventually our server comes back to let us know our meals should be up soon.  I asked again for some sweetener, which to his credit he did apologize for and returned with.  Our meals come out, everything looks good and is just as we ordered.  We still don&#39;t have silverware, but as we both ordered sandwiches, we didn&#39;t need it.  I did ask for some napkins, which we got after asking.  After we were done eating, the server brings a dessert menu and we each order a different kind of cheesecake.  Our server returns again a while later to let me know that they were out of the cheesecake I ordered.  No biggie, and luckily I had a second choice picked out already and didn&#39;t need to see the menu again.  So he goes off and returns what seems like a rather long time later with our cheesecake and some forks.  I definitely don&#39;t fault the server for being out of one of the desserts, but the amount of time we went without seeing the server seemed long throughout the meal. Another issue is that our drinks were never refilled once during the time we were seated.  One entree, one appetizer (I ordered it as a meal), two slices of cheesecake and literally two glasses of iced tea (since we never got refills on them) came to about $50.00, which is too expensive to eat in the cold and be forgotten.  I will still be inclined to get cheesecake to go on occasion, but for all the fuss surrounding this place, I expected better.

I&#39;m so disappointed with the food here. I&#39;ve been to cheesecake favorite in Hawaii, Seattle , and Georgia. Something all three of those places have in common they know how to season their food. I thought on my third time I&#39;d be proven wrong , but I was not strike three for me , safe to say I won&#39;t be coming back to this Cheesecake Factory. I ordered a shrimp pasta dish I can&#39;t remember the name but the pasta was so dry , who likes dry pasta ? NOBODY, when I told my waiter my pasta was extremely dry he laughed and said would you like some cheese , which is also dry. I asked for extra sauce and they brought it out in this little tiny dish as if that sprinkle of sauce was enough to coat that dry pasta. My boyfriend had the salmon, which is hard to mess up so good job there. Let&#39;s talk about his sides he had spinach which they probably just threw in the pan , and he was supposed to have oven roasted broccoli with garlic and red pepper flakes, so they said. The broccoli probably spent one second in the oven if that. You&#39;ll see him add seasoning, I only wish I took a picture of that little dish they gave me for the mound of drySo yes I will not be back period. The service however is great and the drinks were on point, I had the Georgia Peach drink it was tasty. That&#39;s about it.

We had a super great lunch here yesterday, although I have been trying to save money for our credit card.  But O M G, it was well worth every penny.  But D. wouldn&#39;t let me get my usual--spaghetti and meat balls. Instead I got the green chile cheese burger.  It was cooked absolutely perfectly. And the flavor was really good, as if it was ground NY strip steak.  Chile good.  Bun good.  French fries - good.  Service - friendly, thorough, professional!!! D. Had mashed potatoes which were to die for, asparagus, but I can&#39;t remember what his main dish was.  But the bill was pretty reasonable for such good food and what atmosphere! I almost don&#39;t want more people to come here! It is that good. One of the best places in A. At least come here for your birthday. Save up!

You will be very pleased as you step back in tine to the fancy California classic days with a cheerfully decorated ambiance reminecent of the Golden days. You shall be treated like royalty with impeccable service. The food is also delicious

Ordered online for takeout. The ordering system was easy. It even asked if I&#39;d like complimentary sourdough and/or the brown bread to add to my order. The bread is one of my favorite parts of dining in, so I&#39;m so glad they made this an option. I ordered the pasta davinci and jambalaya as wel as a strawberry cheese cake. It gave me an expected ready time and instructions for curbside pickup (how convenient!). When I arrived, I parked in the pickup reserved spots and called the number listed. I only waited a few minutes and my order was out to me. The food was delicious; I&#39;ve ordered all these dishes before and wasn&#39;t disappointed. The serving size was large and had leftovers for a few days.

After a forty five minute wait we were told that a computer glitch was causing such a long delay.  Okay, if that&#39;s the case, maybe let us know.  Three different waitstaff didn&#39;t seem to care.  If any of us had been on a lunch hour it would have been ruined.  We were casual diners, so a bit of a wait would have been okay, Not going to recommend this place.  Indifference shouldn&#39;t be the main entree on the menu

Just a heads up, my review is quite biased because I have a undeniable weakness for banana cream cheesecake. I first discovered this weakness in my childhood, and rediscover it every time I have a slice at Cheesecake Factory whether it&#39;s in Albuquerque, Phoenix or West Coast. I think I&#39;ll go get one today...

The Cheesecake Factory deserves 5 stars for the great food and ambiance, however, the staff at this location seem to be doing you a favor by serving you.<br>This location was the first and only time I&#39;ve ever had a CF employee not be helpful and attentive.  I had to find another waiter to get bread, chase my waiter down for more water and, when I was presented with the bill, I had wanted to order cheesecake and the waiter was obviously bothered by this.<br>Despite the waitstaff, the food is outstanding and I will visit CF often - just not this one.

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. Our server Michael was absolutely terrible. He was very rude, when we needed something he wasn&#39;t around at all.  They took about 15 minutes just to bring out our WATERS and when they brought out our WATERS  there was a cup that was just filled up with ice no water. Also when they brought out our bread it wasn&#39;t fresh. the bread was VERY cold. I had to use the restroom and it was so disgusting that I couldn&#39;t use it. There was no toilet paper there was paper towels all over the floor also there was poop on the seat. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be coming back here anytime soon.
First time there.  Restaurant is so pretty, so inviting.  Had flatbed with goatcheese, arugula, pears and pecans.  Very yum.  Will return

This place sucks! We&#39;ve eaten at other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s before. This location is terrible. The quality and flavor of the food is more like Furrs Cafeteria quality and flavor. No offense to Furrs. We ordered pizza for 1, tacos and fried shrimp and soft drinks. Of course we all had cheesecake. The tab was over $120. I was shocked. Do yourself a favor and avoid this overrated food spot.

An overall outstanding visit. Our party of 2 was sat quickly. Our waiter (Joseph/Danny) was very attentive, professional, and cheerful when taking our order, recommending dishes, and following up on our general satisfaction. Our cocktail, entree, and dessert were all delicious! The general atmosphere of the restaurant was very relaxing and added to our overall satisfaction. We could not have had a better experience.

I can not and will not ever be able to get on the Cheesecake Factory train. <br><br>Their food is pricy, but that&#39;s not the problem, the problem is it is so incredibly salty I find it barely palatable. Every single time without fail it makes my mouth feel like I have spent an hour licking a salt block. I just can not justify spending that much money for crazy amounts of salt. <br><br>The cheesecake is eh. It&#39;s good, it&#39;s different, it&#39;s crazy tall with crazy flavors, but I think you can do better. No, I know you can do better.

Me and my husband went there in weekend for lunch. The ambience was so great and the staff were excellent. In the peak hour, we don&#39;t have to wait in a long time. Both of us ordered burger (forget the name), but it definitely the best burger i&#39;ve ever tried in US. Quite expensive, but the portion also large, complete with side dish. I took salad and my husband had fries. <br><br>Salad was so good with the dressing (honey mustard) and fries also tasty, even they didn&#39;t put so much salt or other spices. I definitely would come back to try other main course.

I can understand the long wait to get a table.  I can understand the long wait for the food.  I can forgive the server ending every sentence with &#34;my friend.&#34;<br><br>HOWEVER, i cannot forgive the luke warm food served.  I cannot forgive the rice served with the miso salmon not cooked all the way.  How do you screw up cooking steamed rice?<br><br>Please get your kitchen together!

I was in Albuquerque on business and decided to visit Cheesecake Factory for dinner.  It has always been in the top 5 restaurants until now.  I decided to try the Salmon special (BIG MISTAKE). The food seemed good as usual. However,  I awoke at approximately 2am  with stomach cramping, which shortly turned into excessive vomiting and diarrhea.  All the symptoms of food poisoning.  It was easy to determine that it was the salmon because that was the only food I consumed that day.  Bad thing, I had to give a presentation the following morning with cold sweats, cramping, and severe dehydration.  I had to leave my conference early and spend the next 9hrs in bed.  As I sit here in the ABQ Sunport still feeling the residual effects, I hate to write this review on one of my favorite eateries, but this was a terrible experience.   I gave two stars only because I think this was an isolated incident.  I would caution against ordering seafood in New Mexico without doing your research.

Absolutely amazing service from Roxanne! Would recommend sitting in her section if you visit this location. She was very attentive and very nice! She greeted our table with a recommendation on the menu, she brought out a salad when my boyfriends food got sent back to the kitchen and while we waited for it to come back out. She brought us out togo drinks. Very good server!

I can honestly say this was one of the most disappointing dining experiences we&#39;ve had in a very long time. <br><br>The restaurant itself is nice, and our waitress was very good, but that&#39;s about it. The food was flavorless to be kind. We all tried something different so we could get a range of their menu, and none of us liked what we were served. We finished with the strawberry shortcake dessert, which was also lackluster, and looked quite a bit smaller than the one at the table next to ours.<br><br>At this point there is no way I could recommend anyone going here. Maybe someday we&#39;ll give it another try, but with so many great local restaurants to choose from, why waste your time with an overrated chain.

Amidst the few negative reviews let&#39;s take a moment to acknowledge that 50% of the experience is the service and 50% is the food. I have been to this location twice and they gave both been positive. <br>My latest visit our server was Joe G. We were seated at our table with no service for 3-5 minutes initially but I&#39;m ok with that. I like to be able to look at the drink menu before being pounced on. He arrived at our table with a smile and quickly took our drink orders. Mai-Tai for a friend. Classic Mojito for me. Water with lemon all around. My Mojito was on point. Delish. My friend said he wished his Mai-Tai was more fruity than he was given but I didn&#39;t taste it so I can&#39;t judge on that. <br>Joe brought our basket of assorted breads and we placed our orders. One Jambalaya, one chicken and biscuits, one veggie burger and i had the Asian chicken lettuce wraps. I did not taste off of anyone&#39;s plate but my own but I will say that my lettuce wraps were crisp and fresh and yummy. I had the veggie burger in my previous visit and it was very flavorful. Same reviews were given by my friend on this visit with her veggie burger. My husband loved his chicken and biscuits. Just his kind of meal. Hearty and hot. Now my friend that ordered the jambalaya orders this same dish every time he comes to Cheesecake Factory. I think he dreams about it at night. It is by far his absolute favorite. I don&#39;t know why he even looks at the menu. <br>Of course we rounded out the meal with cheesecake. Always fantastic but then again they are the Cheesecake Factory!<br>Joe G did an awesome job with serving us. <br>Our water glasses never ran low and we felt very well taken care of. He was very attentive when our bread basket ran low and very accommodating with our request to be provided wheat bread only. Their wheat bread is mouth watering!  That&#39;s what I dream about at night!

I love Cheesecake Factory.  So many choices and have never been disappointed in what I have ordered.  Saturday night I ordered the Honey truffle chicken.  It was beyond wonderful!  How can you go wrong in a place that serves so many cheesecakes?  One of my very favorite restaurants.

There are some nice things here. Pleasant waiter.<br>Nice menu. Nice atmosphere.<br>But there are some problems! The portions are ridiculously huge. It took way too long to get our food. The Hamburger I ordered was way over cooked. Dry.  Could have been good. My grandsons each ordered Orange Chicken. When he found two hairs in the chicken we called our waiter over... this was at about the 2/3s mark during the meal. The waiter said we will just make you another order. I suggested that instead it made sense to just not charge us ... they didn&#39;t listen. And they brought out another when it was time to order dessert. Where is the thought process to this solution? And mostly!!! They should have been mortified!  <br>Get it together Cheesecake Factory!!!

Cheese Cake Factory is the same no matter where you go except for Albuquerque as everyone knows when something new comes into town everyone has to run out and try it. The wait times are long here I came on a Friday around 4pm to try and beat the rush but there was still an hour + wait. The food is pretty good and they offer a huge selection and have just about everything you can think of. I was told the fish and chips were good so went with that they portions are huge and the food was great. I really enjoyed the avocado egg rolls. But for the amount of wait staff they have running around everywhere you would think the service would be top notch but service was lacking but I figure as time goes on that will improve as this is still a new restaurant. Also prices are a bit steep but overall worth it. Once service improves I will bump up my rating a star.

Will not accommodate handicap persons! Was quoted 30-40 min wait on the phone by a receptionist. She wouldn&#39;t take my name down unless we were there physically. I said I have a person in a wheelchair I can&#39;t leave them she said I&#39;m sorry  SO I Left my handicap family member alone because she wanted to eat there really bad, while I literally ran to put my name in and was told when I got there which was less than 5 min that it&#39;s 1 and a half hours wait!! Talked to manager who was completely of no help. His response was well we&#39;re learning. Learning what? To misquote people especially handicap. This place isn&#39;t worth that wait! Trust me I grew up in California and have been there before. I&#39;m more appalled at the lack of customer service especially towards people with disabilities! No wonder why their ratings in this new place are so LOW!

The white bread  we got was really hard compared to the brown bread .  I ordered the lemon-herb roasted chicken and it was really moist, the carrots tasted great, I would definitely order this again. My friend got the cobb salad . Her first salad  was a little wilted  and the MGR was very nice and replaced it for free.   The waitress started off attentive but I think she got overwhelmed with other tables and forgot about us, fortunately another waitress was helpful.

We&#39;re from out of town.  We came here when they first opened, good food, good service and very clean.  Our second visit, not so good.  Dirty floors, booth seat was torn up, asked for another booth, lettuce in salad looked wilted and brown, turkey burger was mushy, chicken had no flavor.  Service was so, so.  The bathroom trash can was spilling onto the floor.  We&#39;ve eaten at other Cheesecake Factory restaurants.  This one was not up to par.  Hope the management does something to bring it up to Cheesecake Factory standards.

Nice atmosphere and seating outside was great. Service prompt and attentive. Food was good. Came for brunch and got eggs Benedict and daughter got thai salmon. Pretty good..green sauce that came with salmon had a weird taste. Salmon glaze was super good though! Got salted carmel cheesecake..yum.

Wow. Unbelievable. If I could do less than one star I would. <br>I bought a slice of red velvet cheesecake to go. I should mention that the young lady at the to go counter was sitting on the counter, the counter the orders are placed on, when I got there. <br>Upon arrival Home, less than an hour later, the cheesecake was stale to the point of being inedible. <br>I called and spoke to John the manager. I told him my issue and he started laughing. Saying he couldn&#39;t believe it could be stale. <br>I told him I wouldn&#39;t take time to call if it wasn&#39;t and his reply restated his position that they sell so much it couldn&#39;t be stale. <br>I don&#39;t take being called a liar easily so I told him I would call his boss on the morning. <br>When your restaurant is called Cheesecake Factory, you should at least get the cheesecake right.

We have been here a few times and the food is always delicious, but always kind of slow. I always try to change and try new things and it has all been great. The steak Diane is delicious! Also they have really good Sangria here at a nice price! And if you don&#39;t care about the price you&#39;re about to pay for cheesecake....it&#39;s absolutely heavenly! We&#39;ve had a couple servers that have not been very knowledgeable of the menu or bar menu, but our last server Dominic was by far the best! Friendly, knowledgeable, fast, and took care of our large group with ease. Will definitely be returning!
So excited when they opened up. Place is nice and clean. Kids friendly and good service. Foods and cheesecake is kind of overpriced.
Great service and great food! This place is amazing! It is always worth the wait. The prices are a tad bit high but it&#39;s what is expected from such a nice place.

Have never been here before today was going to be my first time. I was at Victoria secret and messaged my mom to get us a table. 5 mins later, I noticed my mom was having a hard time getting attention from the hostess. I went up to the hostess and asked her &#34; how long is the wait?&#34; She replies back snooty &#34; For however long it takes us to seat you&#34; My mouth dropped and I said wow you didn&#39;t have to say it like that I was only asking because I have a dr appointment so wanted to know if I would have time. I said never mind I won&#39;t eat here and I won&#39;t ever go back.

Attended the mock service on Friday February 19, 2016.  the restaurant is beautiful inside and out.  The owner of all The Cheesecake Factories was in attendance and was mingling with everyone. The buffalo wings were delicious for an appetizer.  I ordered the new to the menu, shrimp sandwich. It was huge and very delicious. My wife had the Sheila&#39;s salad and that was also huge and delicious!  We shared a vanilla bean cheesecake for dessert. Best cheesecake i have ever eaten.  I&#39;m very happy The Cheesecake Factory finally came to Albuquerque, NM.  Totally recommend it!!

If you come on weekend is a long wait of course but that&#39;s not a big deal, the service was a slow. The food was very delicious and their drinks too. Better be! Is pricy! The have a huge list of cheesecakes and they are good big slices you they can be shared. I had the bacon burger the slice of bacon are big and yummy the meat in the burger is prefect! Overall enjoyed it will return.
My favorite place for pasta and cheesecake! Delicious food, nice environment, and great service.

Enormous wait for Im not sure what.  The service was subpar. However This is a chain restaurant and this location is up to par with the other Cheesecake Factory I have had around the country.   However the wait is simply not worth it.  Also it&#39;s is expensive!!!!!!!   Albuquerque offers so many better choices than here.

I am not to sure why cheesecake factory dosent have a higher rating.<br>We was so excited that Albuquerque finally has a cheesecake factory, we used to live in Tucson and loved CF until it went down hill but I will save that for another review.<br>We have been to CF 3 times now since it has opened and my oh my we haven&#39;t been disappointed both my husband and I have tried something new from the menu each time and everything has been amazing from the pasta, to the steak to the salads and cheesecake oh the cheesecake the choices are far and plenty and the flavors are divine. <br>Cheesecake factory is my go to dinner place when the hubby asks me where I want to go and I don&#39;t foresee that changing. Keep up the good work CF I for one am glad ur here in Albuquerque.

I have been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s across the country and this one is by far the worst. They STILL can&#39;t get their recipes right! I have given them sufficient chances going there several times now for dinners and brunch today, which was the last straw. They couldn&#39;t even do a simple Eggs Benedict right. The hollandaise sauce was putrid and inedible. Pancakes are served with their &#34;own syrup&#34; which is basically melted butter with a splash of maple flavoring- gross! So they gave us some cheap Smuckers Lite Syrup packets, like in an IHOP. Pathetic. Their service is like their food, inconsistent and sloppy. No one stands out as exceptional, they are all par for the course, borderline rude since its obvious they are just as frustrated with their kitchen. I always knew that New Mexico could never uphold this company&#39;s culinary or customer service standard and I was right.

First impression:<br>I thought going on a Sunday night wouldn&#39;t be so bad as far as wait times, and when we put our name down we we&#39;re given a 15-20 minute time frame which was fine with us. We saw about 3 different couples who came in after us get seated before us. And a family of 4 who came in and within 5 minutes of waiting they were sat as well. We ended up waiting 35-45 minutes until we got seated. So that put a damper on the night so far. <br><br>Server:<br>Once we were seated our server greeted us quickly got our drink orders, and put in our child&#39;s food. When we came back around the second time we asked him about the Crab and spinach dip he said it was amazing its not the fake crab/imitation so we said we would like to try that we also put in our main course during this time. We hadn&#39;t seen our server since we ordered our food but child&#39;s food came shortly after which was brought out by another server.Maybe after 20 minutes or so still no server our main course came out, we didn&#39;t get our appetizer and my sides were wrong on my plate. Finally our server came to check on us to make sure everything was alright I let him know about the app and the sides. I&#39;m assuming he never put in the app because when we asked him about it he tried to play if off like &#34;oh well let me look into that for you.&#34; We told him we didn&#39;t want it now but it think if we were paid attention to more this obviously wouldn&#39;t have happened. After this it seems like he was rushing us to get us out of there. <br><br>Food:<br>Fish &amp; Chips: More batter than fish, was okay nothing special wont be ordering again. <br>Fettuccine Alfredo w/chicken: Good full of flavor<br>Kids Mac and Cheese: Very cheesy in flavor but good size portion.<br><br>Overall:<br>We will probably be back again but on a slower day than the weekends. I don&#39;t see why people like this place so much.

A friend and I waited approximately 20 mins. to be seated, after advising the hostess that the first available table would be fine.  We had to let the hostess know that a table was available 10 minutes after our arrival.<br><br>Our server was absolutely horrible. His lack of attention to our table was unfortunately painful. We had to waive our server down to let him know we wanted more iced tea and soda. He brought fresh luke warm tea without ice. Again we waived him down to advise that the tea wasn&#39;t &#34;iced tea&#34; as it was missing ice.<br><br>We finished our meal and waited about 20 minutes before we, again, waived our server down to let him know we wanted our left overs placed in a to-go boxes. Keeping in mind that the restaurant was busy, our server walked passed our table six times prior to our getting his attention.<br><br>We advised our server we wished to order a couple of slices of cheesecake, also to go. Another 15 minutes went by before we were served our desert on plates. We advised our server that it was supposed to be in to-go boxes.  Our server decided to throw a bit of attitude at us.  I took control of his attitude immediately and respectfully told him of our concerns regarding his serving skills.  Of course this just made him delay with providing our check.  I went to the bar and asked for the manager on duty.  After expressing my concerns to this gentleman, we received our check and were surprised that a discount for our inconvenience was not applied.<br><br>The server was left with a $2.00 tip and a note suggesting he have a remedial course in proper serving procedures.<br><br>My review is such: <br><br>1.  Initial wait time:  Within reason for time of day. <br>2.  Letting the hostess know if the available table unsatisfactory.<br>3.  Food quality and quality:. Excellent<br>4.  Server&#39;s attention to customer&#39;s needs: Completely Unsatisfactory.<br>5.  Discount for inconvenience and Server&#39;s unprofessional attitude:. Unsatisfactory<br><br>As a General Manager for a Restaurant in Los Lunas, this experience was completely inexcusable and the server should be provided corrective action to correct is serving skills immediately and or be terminated.<br><br>I do not recommend, at this time, eating here at peak hours.  Go on non-peak hours when service should be excellent.<br><br>The food was fantastic. Props are due without hesitation. The plates provided plenty of food. It was almost too much.

Always great service, friendly staff and good food. Usually quite busy so a bit of a wait but it&#39;s expected. Best part is they are always willing to accept special requests on orders. Of course banana cream cheesecake is always a WIN!

Me and my husband went into the Cheesecake Factory yesterday afternoon around 2:30pm. We were asked to sit on the patio. It was a nice warm day and they had the outside heaters on regardless so we were hot sitting out there. We ordered an appetizer and entrees. We waited 20-25 mins and got our entrees.. Then 5-10 mins later the appetizer came. Our waitress acted like this was no big deal and just offered to box up our uneaten appetizer since we were no longer hungry for it. I paid for the entire meal but I won&#39;t go back! It&#39;s not ok to bring the appetizer after I&#39;ve eaten half my entree!
The wait was over an hour but if your patient it&#39;s worth the wait ! . most of the bad reviews are from impatient people. The service is good and the food is spectacular!

I will admit I was skeptical when we decided to come dine but we had a gift card so here we are. Upon entering the restaurant is beautiful and the line for cheesecake is long. To our surprise the bar has a Happy Hour from 4-6 so we decided to have a seat. Service was outstanding and the happy hour menu was generous with diverse choices for anyone&#39;s palate.  The avocado egg rolls were amazing! We finished with the Kahlua cheesecake which was the perfect ending to a delightful experience at a corporate establishment.

It&#39;s the time of year for Team Celebrations! My manager told us we were going to lunch and then said The Cheesecake Factory and my face fell...I had been here twice before and was not impressed either time so wasn&#39;t really looking forward to our lunch. This time however I was pleasantly surprised by both the service and food!! Our waitress took care of all 12 of us by herself and our glasses were never empty, she smiled the whole time, and didn&#39;t roll her eyes when some of us struggled to figure out what to have from the very large menu. Last time I was there with a party of about 8 and the service was super slow and our waiter seriously huffed when we were a little slow in ordering. I got the Chicken Reisling this time around and it&#39;s was melt in my mouth deliciousness!! Because of our wonderful waitress (wish I had gotten her name) and the yummyness I will give them another chance without being dragged there! Hopefully they can keep this up...
A good chain restaurant in a good location. My first visit to ABQ&#39;s CF was a hit. Great service, great food quality. You really can&#39;t go wrong with anything on the extensive menu.

We liked our experience here. Very comparable to a place like elephant bar or an expensive chilis. The menu has like 15 pages so be prepared for lots of choices. Our waiter was great (which is important to us) and the ambiance of the restaurant is very cool. It is a little pricey though and there might be better value found other places. We will be back for dessert for sure though.

Beautiful restaurant, with the same massive menu that they&#39;re known for. If possible, ask for Jessica, she&#39;s hilarious and such a great server even at the end of a hectic opening day. Also, ask about the Georgia Peach. It&#39;s great.

Beautiful restaurant great service but the food just was not there to match. We had a mac &amp; cheese burger and it was tasty but just not there. I would give the cheese cake five stars if I could. I would give five stars to all the staff if I could. But the food was not all that hype. But it&#39;s a beautiful place and a wonderful experience
Drinks are tiny and over priced at best. Margarita&#39;s come half glass full, with mostly ice. The service is good to poor at best. Plenty of better options in Albuquerque that provide better value.

The food was good and was served warm.  The cheesecake was delicious as one would expect.<br><br>The service was painfully slow.  I got there after my husband.  He had requested a high chair for our baby but they never brought one so I grabbed one that wasn&#39;t being used.  It was broken and unsafe to use.  The back of the high chair was loose and spinning.  I asked for a different one and this one also was loose and a bit wobbly.  For a restaurant at this price point and being fairly new, I really expected better equipment.<br><br>The server took a long time to take our order.  It was getting to the point that I was about to walk over to the servers station and ask someone to come take our order.  Then she showed up.  After that our food came promptly and our drinks were refilled but it shouldn&#39;t have taken as long as it did to get the process started.<br><br>I have been to other locations and this one was the loudest by far.  I may go back but it will be a while before I do.

Been to cheesecake factory in cali and in phoenix so the expectation is always high and this cheesecake factory didnt disappoint....great atmosphere...got to sit outside under some heat lamps and fires burning...great great ambience.<br><br>As for the food,cheesecake factor never disappoints.....had steak diane and shrimp scampi...wow!.....yummy!....waitor was super!...even considering its brand new and suoer busy...if youve been to cheesecake factory before this one is just more of the same...great food and great service....location is excellent in uptown center which makes the whole experince great...highly recommend

I have already become a regular here, because their food is amazing! My 1st dish was Steak Diane. The beef medallions were super tender and flavored with just the right amount of wine. The shiitake mushrooms were a flavorful addition. They paired it with homemade red skin mashed potatoes. My 2nd dish was the Hangar Steak, delicious! It is served with sautéed asparagus and wasabi mashed potatoes. Save room for dessert, because you will have the best cheesecake in the world, hence the name of the restaurant. Stick with the basic cheesecake with the fresh strawberries, pure perfection! The wait time is improving, since when they 1st opened. I&#39;m looking forward to many more tasty meals!

What a blast! I met my group of girls for my birthday lunch and Katie took great care of us. The avocado rolls were really good. I got the Evelyn&#39;s pasta dish which was yummy. They brought me my choice of cheesecake and sang happy birthday. Very sweet. The red velvet cheesecake is amazing. Go early! We met at 11:30am and there was no wait but it was packed as we were leaving. Long lines to get in.

Opted to sit out on the heated, &#34;enclosed&#34; patio since it would be a 20-30 min wait for a table of 4. No big deal we thought, until we were sat at the very end which was not enclosed and very cold. Server came and got us our drink orders and brought bread. I asked for small bread plates for my kids so they weren&#39;t setting it down on the table. Never got those. Drinks were empty for most of the dinner. I never got my food. My two kids and husbands food came, served said it would just be a minute for mine. However, both kids and my husband finished their food before the server ever came back. She said she spoke with the manager and they were going to take it off my bill, but would I like to get it now or take it home. I opted to take it home since everyone else had already finished and we weren&#39;t about to wait for dessert now. Got it home and there was absolutely no flavor to the Lemon Garlic shrimp I ordered. Threw over half of it away. Thankfully we used a gift card, but not sure we&#39;ll even be back to use the rest. The manager never came over and no apology from anyone.
Really good food they have a lot to choose from on the menu staff ideally nice and friendly and sweet!!

I just had the worst experience here. The customer service was horrible.  My food took 35-40min. And when it finally came they forgot to tell me half my order was out. And be another 20min. And all MANAGER says is that they are not gonna charge me for something I didn&#39;t eat.

Skip the meals. Go for the desserts.<br>I went with my family on New Years Day and nobody was overwhelmed by the entrees.<br>Very bland and slow to arrive. The quality was no better than any other chain diner.<br>The desserts, on the other hand, were outstanding.<br>Next time, we will go for coffee and the rich dessert items.
Recommended, food was excellent &amp; the staff was great. Nice portions enough to share one entree.

Albuquerque is so fortunate to finally get a Cheesecake Factory! Absolutely my favorite restaurant. I hear complaints about the wait but that is to be expected. Once things settle and the staff gets accustomed it will be better. I have never had a bad meal here. And trust me, that is a lot of meals at Cheesecake Factories across the country.

We enjoyed the dessert but our entree was another story. We ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp and the teriyaki chicken. The bang bang tasted very strongly of the sweet orange juice concentrate and the teriyaki had several bones and there were fried bananas which still had a produce sticker on it.  We will not be going back there.

Had a very good experience here for dinner on Black Friday. We had a party of 5 and came in right at 5 pm. Waited less than 2 min for a table and our waitress promptly took our drink order. We&#39;ve been here a few times before and has less than stellar service so I was apprehensive about returning but everyone was craving something different and CKF has a huge menu.  I am glad we came here, the service was great, our food was very good and the ambiance also nice.  We had a great time and will return soon!

This is the worst cheecake factory I have been to, I have been to many up and down the coast of California and in Arizona. The staff at this location lack training in prompt customer service and screening plates before expo. The food takes twice as long to receive as any other location. Even simple appetizers you&#39;re looking at a minimum of 30 minutes. This is without it being busy. The bread is rarely fresh and the food is always barely passing off as ok. Don&#39;t get your hopes up for the cheesecake factory you know to be, it will disappoint to say the least.
Beautiful space, good servers, yummy cheesecake, mediocre food. All in all not worth the price. Cheddars is a better choice for my dollars!

Came here for dinner with a friend. Pretty busy, but said it would be about 20-40min. which was fine because we were able to run into the mall and shop for things and look around. After 30min. we returned and got seated 5min. later. We sat outside in the patio area and it was quite chilly out, but with the heat lamps, it was quite comfortable. I even took my jacket off. Service was good and the food was descent. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi which was not bad. Good portions. I had to take the rest of my food home. I was actually really excited that they had their pumpkin cheesecake, my favorite. I like the more NY style Cheesecake, which is more dense. The CF cheesecake is more light, but they only carry the pumpkin in the fall, so I couldn&#39;t miss out. Good ambiance and sitting outside wasn&#39;t too loud, so it was a pretty enjoyable evening.

Chinese chicken salad:  It only had about two tablespoons of chicken (which was very bland). The other toppings were very skimpy. The dressing was terrible. The greens were bland. Pretty much a failure all around, and expensive. Even Wendy&#39;s does a better salad for half the cost. They also forgot to send one of the orders so one person did not get their entree, just some bread.

Amazing! Food was very tasty and came out fast. Not bad considering I waited 90 minutes which is fine and I didn&#39;t  mind specially for day 2 of being open. Waitress was very good and nice and management was great. Very clean! Will be returning soon.

Have not been to a Cheesecake Factory in years and I was pleasantly surprised! We ordered crab bites to share. For main dishes, my boyfriend ordered the orange chicken and I ordered the shrimp scampi/steak combo. His orange chicken was really good! it tasted like they used fresh orange zest and I didn&#39;t feel like the breading was too thick. Rice was a little dry, but I imagine this is reheated or made in large batches. My food was also good. The scampi was not sopping in butter like at most chain restaurants and the steak was well cooked. No cheesecake this time, but we plan to go back!<br><br>This last part is more of a personal complaint, but just FYI, the music on the patio was terrible! Very sappy/cheesy pop songs, similar to a soundtrack you&#39;d hear in places like K-mart.

They do not have drink prices on the menu- someone in my group ordered a skinny cosmo- it was 11.25!!!! <br>That is a ridiculous price for a drink in Albuquerque- the manager came over and blamed corporate - did nothing else!! Terrible customer service!

First time at the Cheesecake Factory -- had Lauren R. as our waitress and she was AWESOME. Drink orders were taken and brought back extremely quick and she was very knowledgeable when it came to the menu. The avocado egg rolls were to die for and the four cheese pasta was so flavorful! Between the bread, appetizers, and our meals, we were so full but decided to order dessert anyway due to the very informative cheesecake presentation! Overall great experience. We will definitely be back here!

Food is great. Service on the hand was not so good. We went party of five, our waiter forgot one plate, we had a birthday and failed to tell us the cheesecake menu he provided to the birthday person was not complimentary. Our waiter hardly checked on us. We didn&#39;t get a discount for the missing plate we received late. Our poor guest sat there hungry until she receieved her food. I&#39;m a great tipper for great service, and the service was not great.
Yummy yummy. Amazing customer service. I had to speak to the manager just to tell him how satisfied I was. Oh and don&#39;t forget to try the salted caramel cheesecake.

This by far is one of the best Cheese Cake Factory&#39;s I have eaten at. I must admit I originally thought the food would be mediocre being so far from the other locations. Man was I wrong. Keep up the good work guys! I will be back.

I really like the Cheesecake Factory - the menu, the drinks, and the atmosphere.  We eat there about 3-4 times a year.  Our server on this last visit was not friendly or helpful at all.  She NEVER smiled or made us feel welcome. It was early evening midweek, so they were not super busy.  Jennifer failed to tell us about the specials and so we ordered our meal.  We heard about them from the server at the table next to us.  When Jennifer returned to ask about our drinks, I asked why she didn&#39;t tell me about the special, because it was a pan-seared salmon dish and I had ordered herb<br>-crusted salmon!  She tried to tell me it was the same thing, and then she tried to say what I ordered was better.  After a short back and forth, and never an apology, she finally offered me the special.  Everything turned out fine and our meals were great, but a server who is disinterested in her guests makes the whole dining out experience very unpleasant.

Gluten-Free - YES!!<br><br>My best friend and I went to go visit the cheesecake factory in Albuquerque. They&#39;re gluten-free free menu is amazing and their food was generous in portion and absolutely delicious!!  Five-Stars!!!

This time was not quite as good. I had the Mexican Tortilla Salad with chicken. It was very tasty, but I could count on the fingers of one hand the bites of chicken that were in it. Also, they had some kind of screw up with our order and it was a fairly long wait to get the food. They came over and apologized, and even comp&#39;d a piece of cheesecake for my companion to make amends. None of this would prevent me from returning, but it was a notch below my last visit.
Place use to be a favorite, but service sucks now. Should be better for price you pay.

Went in on a Monday night, was quite empty. Walked in was seated right away, ordered something to drink then ordered dinner. Waiter was friendly and helpful, I believe his name was Nicholas. Got the check and left! The food was great was a bit greasy maybe because it was pasta. Overall was a good experience!

Honestly, I didn&#39;t come here expecting to be wowed. The last time I ate at a Cheesecake Factory, I felt it was overrated. But (!) this experience was great. Service was exceptional. I had the chicken piccata and it was delicious. Later, I had the key lime cheesecake, which was sinfully excellent. Yes, a bit pricey, but I expected that.

Am I the only one to notice that my review about the racial slur that I was called by one of their employees (off duty)is the only review to go unanswered by management.  After 4 phone calls to Customer Service - none of which they followed up and responded to - they sent me $75 in gift certificates which I will mail back to them.  How about some training in manners and diversity for your staff and management?  Would go a long way............

This is the worst service possible first time eating here and the meatballs and pasta came out cold and then the pasta was  or has been on the counter to long and was never hot run like you find a restaurant that will want your business and will provide you the customer service you deserve, don&#39;t come here it&#39;s your regret as I had. Received. Will never come back they should close this place and lock the doors. Again don&#39;t come here!!!!the company sent me a message and stated they will talk to the staff I guess they feel there is no problems there as I stated before do waste your time going there to eat  can you imagine paying or being changed 16.99  for the worthless cold meatballs and pasta and all they will do is talk to the staff what a waste of time the cheese cake factory has made fire the true cause the head. Cook and the waitress and the manager . Any questions I didn&#39;t think so I will not ever bring family members to this in professional restaurant  or friends you can dress the building but the food and service is the worst stay away don&#39;t go there I will let any one know of this poor service and the cold food !

I generally love the Cheesecake Factory and have eaten in almost every one of them across the country; but today our office placed a take out order for lunch and besides the cheesecake someone ordered, almost  everything else was maybe a C-. My toasted sandwich was cold and the bread was soggy. An absorbent mat under it could have kept the moisture from sitting on the bottom of the plastic container. Pizza was cold. Fries were wimpy. Come on, TCF you should know better. Find some &#34;to go&#34; containers that work.

Let me preface this by saying I had worked for this organization for almost two years and took great pride in the food and customer service. I still work in the customer service industry in another capacity and understand that there are times when things are out of your control. And then there are other times when the experience is made poor because of a lazy or poor server. Unfortunately tonight a one star rating is being quite generous.<br><br>We had a group of 13 guys out for dinner and drinks to celebrate a day off work. The service was poor at best, our server made no mention of any specials, prefaced by saying bread would take awhile to come out and assumed we all wanted water to drink when he first greeted the table. He simply could have asked our drink order and appetizer order and got the night started. Unprofessional table greet and start. Furthermore when we said we wanted to order some appetizers, he only took our liquor orders and then left. By the time he realized he hadn&#39;t taken the appetizer order (15min or so) we had decided to just place a food order. Instead of taking our food order when we said we weren&#39;t going to order our appetizers and just food, he walked away AGAIN to get our drinks instead of getting our food order. Furthermore upon delivering our drinks he made the comment to one of the guys &#34;that our drinks are strong so pace yourself, I don&#39;t want to have to cut you off&#34;....not sure the reason for this unprofessional comment.<br><br>After receiving our drinks we assumed the bread that was &#34;still cooking in the oven&#34; (as told to us by our server) would be coming shortly. Another 10 minutes passed. When the bread arrived it wasn&#39;t even hot. So either he was lying to us about the bread cooking or he was lazy. Furthermore he brought us enough bread for a group of 6 people...maybe. He asked for more bread and he only brought it to one end of the table. <br><br>With our food order in, we decided to have another round of drinks. Our server at this point made the comment that he couldn&#39;t allow us more than one drink per hour because he wouldn&#39;t want to cut us off. We had been here at the restaurant for over an hour and was on our 2nd round. Quite unprofessional and honestly uncalled for. We weren&#39;t even close to intoxicated and if anything super frustrated at the poor service we were receiving and yet STILL ordering $10-14 cocktails for our group.<br><br>Finally after being told on 2 different occasions that our food would be right out, it arrived about 40min after our order. I can understood a groups long ticket time but instead of an apology for the wait or anything...maybe even a manager stopping by...we got nothing. On top of all of that, the guy who was paying for the entire meal did not get his food until everyone was FINISHED eating their meal. He ordered a burger :/ seriously <br><br>Our server said he&#39;d try to make it up to us with a slice of cheesecake or something. And yet he didn&#39;t have a manager stop by to say sorry or do anything to make up for it. We had 13 people order dinner and 3 rounds of drinks. You do the math on the tab. Furthermore he didn&#39;t even do a dessert presentation or insist on the cheesecake slice because of his blunder with the burger.<br><br>Finally after getting the check and getting ready to leave, the gentleman who was paying the tab for our company outing spoke to the manager on our way out the door. Her only response was &#34;I&#39;m sorry.&#34; <br><br>She offered to do NOTHING to accommodate the poor service and lackluster experience on a MONDAY night. <br><br>To say the ball was dropped on this experience would be a generously kind way of venting frustration. After having worked for the company in one of the top performing locations in the country for almost two years, I&#39;m somewhat disgusted by the lack of care for the patrons and guest experience. Obviously &#34;ultimate guest satisfaction&#34; was not a core value of the management or staff we encountered. <br><br>It&#39;s unfortunate from a personal level because of how much time and energy I had given to this organization and yet to have my fellow co workers have this experience.<br><br>Management please fix this.

One star because the cheesecake is great! From the greeting at the hostess stand,  the horribly long wait (while table after table needed to be bussed)  to receiving our appetizer with the meal,  the meal had hair particles in the soup and under the plate. Ps don&#39;t order the French dip sandwich-  couldn&#39;t tell what was grizzle and what was cheese!<br>No thanks.....we wont be going back to this place again.
A little bit of a wait for a large party and no reservations, but: Food . . . Good; cheesecake . . . Good; drinks . . . Good.  I got the filet mignon and it was cooked to perfection.

I gave it two stars because the good was decent but the service I had was really disappointing. After being greeted and brought drinks and bread, we waited a while for our server to return to ask for plates and silverware. By the time we got them, the bread was cold. They brought us a bloody mary instead of a blood orange margarita. Our order of calamari came with chicken tenders and only half an order of calamari. When I told the server, he took the chicken tenders away to show the kitchen and came back and said &#34;well, you got extra.&#34; No, I didn&#39;t. Nothing replaced the chicken tenders. When I asked for bread after our food came, the server never brought it to us. I finally told him that we didn&#39;t need the bread anymore when he gave us the check and he had the audacity to say I never asked for it. I&#39;ve had better service here but they&#39;ve really slipped. No manager ever came to see us. I don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll be back.

Perfect place, time, and service for lunch. Our server was very attentive and made sure everything was great every few minutes. From the cucumber lemonade and cucumber mojito, the stuffed mushrooms, and the entrees with salad and pizza and lemon garlic shrimp everything tasted soooo good. Everything was paced perfectly and service was phenomenal. We sat on the patio and even though it was a little chilly they made sure the heaters were on to make it comfortable for us. Definitely returning soon.

This place is amazing! It had amazing food and the costumer service was awesome! It was lovely! The cheesecake was the highlight of my time there. It was great, and I recommend going there. The only thing was that it was a long wait, but it was totally worth it! My favorite meal is the Thai Lettuce Wraps.
The food was very good! Well served portions, had great flavor. The wait time was very minimal. The cheesecake was delicious! The service could use some improvement but overall very good!
There was a bit of a wait but that&#39;s expected of a new restaurant.   The food was great, generous portions.  I recommend the eggplant parm.  Plus the cheesecake was to die for.
I feel this place is over priced and the food is just okay. Desert is good but not great. Also be prepared to be here a while at least an hour or two.
The Cheesecake Factory is a hopping place. Sometimes too busy.  But I&#39;ve had three great meals and great service there in a row.  Thumbs up.
Awful service! Appetizers took forever to come out! Alcohol drinks were served before any fountain drinks. First time going and I will not return.

I went here for the first time for my birthday, and it was a great experience! The food was awesome even though I thought the menu was a bit much to look at. I managed to catch them for brunch, so I ordered a breakfast version of a jambalaya. It was the best jambalaya I&#39;ve had. The interior of the place is very beautiful, and they have a lot space! The smaller tables are nice a private, so it&#39;s perfect to have a date! The waitress we had was very friendly, and she was pretty! To top it all off, the dessert was amazing! It wouldn&#39;t be called the Cheesecake Factory if it didn&#39;t have awesome cheesecakes. They definitely had lengthy list of different cakes. The one I chose was the carrot cake cheesecake, and it was stellar! It definitely was the best cheesecake as well as the best carrot cake I&#39;ve ever had!
Man there fish and chip are pretty good but not the best but I&#39;m glad there&#39;s one in Albuquerque there cheese cake is good to

The most racist and disorganized establishment ever. Waited in line and was so excited on Saturday, May 21 2016 @11:30 am.  We were the first one to sit in the patio, but waitress continued to ignore us for 15 mins and took orders from every other table that came after us and I still stayed patient until it was obvious. The only difference that they happened to be Caucasian. When you charge  outrageous prices for basic food, invest a little class in treating your customers with some respect. Nobody should be purposely made to feel so disrespected. I eat out a lot and this is one restaurant that will never be a place I come back to. Take your greedy racist attitude and get out of my town where we live in harmony and treat everybody with respect regardless of their race. It&#39;s a community built with loving minorities and Cheesecake factory does not fit in here.
11.25 for one cocktail drink !!! No price for it on the menu either just let you order it totally oblivious to the price gouging. Very disappointed never going back

We came in today with a party of six and only had to wait 5 minutes for a table. Service was extremely fast and our waiter S.Jerica was amazing. The kids got their food out quickly and we never had to wait for a refill on our drinks. The food was delicious and we had pretty big portions for the price. We will definitely be coming back!

The service was horrendous. Do not let Alejandra serve you! They forgot our appetizer and when we ordered something they were out of they could not honor our substitution request. They did not reduce the bill or work with us in any way. This was my first and last time at the Cheesecake Factory! Way to bring down our 4th of July dinner!

We had a large group. They ran out of turkey so two people had to reorder and one of their plates came out long after everyone else&#39;s. None of the food was good. The sandwich I ordered was dry even after I asked for additional sauce. We had a very nice waitress.

I&#39;ll start off by saying if you don&#39;t have any patience for waiting I highly suggest you save cheesecake factory for another time.  After some shopping me and my girlfriend decide to eat at cheesecake factory because cheesecake!  We knew we would be waiting awhile which wasn&#39;t a big deal.  We got our buzzer and sat outside and chatted.  Our wait time was 25-40 minutes.  Not a big deal we came knowing this.  As time went on it seemed though like we would never be called.  At one point we contemplated going elsewhere but decided since we&#39;ve stuck it out almost 40 minutes it would seem like a waste of time to leave.  At exactly 40 minutes our buzzer went off.  Thank goodness because my tummy was screaming at me!<br>We were sat at a table in the bar area which was nice because it was Saturday night and I got to watch college football.<br>We ordered some appetizers and my girlfriend had a beer while I had just water.  When out waitress came and took our dinner order I orders  I ordered pasta with mushrooms and veggies and my girlfriend ordered a veggie burger.  At this point our waitress asked how she wanted it cooked and we both looked at each other like ummm all the way thank you and my girlfriend said isn&#39;t it fully cooked? The waitress said well I think there is still meat in it at which point we both stared at her like excuse me?! We both told her its a veggie burger there shouldn&#39;t be any meat in it at all.  Our waitress then picked up the menu just to make sure.  She said og your right, I&#39;ll put your order in and have your food out.  After she left we had to sit and think about what she just said.  I&#39;m just saying its a veggie burger not a veggie and meat burger.  She was a nice girl bit the fact that you don&#39;t know that simple is kind of a let down.  Although she was very attentive to us that was her only flaw.  We both and cheesecake and I also had a hot chocolate.  As always the cheesecake was amazing, I had the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake which was amazing!!! The hot chocolate was also chocolatly and delish!  Our expierence was good and we will be back again!

Recently I decided to go gluten-free for health reasons, and that has been a lifechanging experience for me (at least when it comes to eating out ;) ). One of my friends went to eat at the Cheesecake Factory and said &#34;Hey LJ! Guess what? They have a ton of gluten free food!&#34; which of course made me say &#34;Let&#39;s go. NOW.&#34; I got a gluten-free pasta dish and it was sinfully delicious. I was a little sad that there weren&#39;t many gluten-free appetizer options, but the guacamole was delicious. And then...there was a Godiva gluten-free cheesecake. I&#39;m not a big fan of chocolate, but I was desperate for a guilty, sinful, glutenless dessert and my desperation led me to a DELICIOUS slice. Our server was great, the food was good, the ambiance was nice, and I got to stuff my little gluten-free face. Overall, a great experience.

If you dig a 3 hour wait, only being seated if your full party is present after said 3 hour wait and, finally, crappy food all around, then this place is for you.  A true slice of all that is wrong with chain restaurants. My niece wanted to go for her birthday, otherwise would have never considered it. Proved right. Can I give zero stars?

We waited for 2 hours and didn&#39;t even get in the building. The hostess kelps telling us the wait would be  2 hours. After talking with some people that were seated they said they had been waiting 1 1/2 hours on the food. What a disappointment .

Stop overrating ABQ.  Yes, it&#39;s exciting to get a new name in the Q, but the food is simply average.  Service at this point is nice because country wide trainers are here for the hiring expo.  Hopefully the locals will remember the training.

This was our first time to this location. I&#39;ve been to one in Vegas before. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad, but for it being early afternoon (2:15) it was already starting to get packed. Parking isn&#39;t too bad as you can always park further out or walk through the mall to get there as well. Our waitress, Melissa, was excellent. She was able to suggest different drinks and food options to us. Food portions are huge even if you order off the lunch specials. If you palm on coming make sure you have an appetite or you&#39;ll be taking some home. We had two small snacks, the fried zucchini and cubano rolls. Both excellent options. For our meals we had the lunch meatloaf, the pasta carbonara with chicken and the bacon bacon cheeseburger. You will not be disappointed with any of them. And for the meatloaf and pasta being the smaller portions we were still taking half of it home with us. And don&#39;t even get started on the cheesecake options. Too many to choose from that you will be tempted to take some to go to try later. Overall it was and excellent place to get food and drinks. Only drawback is the price for cocktails drinks. To me $10.50 is way too much though it was very good.

I have always heard great things about the Cheesecake Factory but never had the privilege to try it. So when I heard that one was opening up in Albuquerque I got a little excited  so going in I had high expectations and I must say I&#39;m not disappointed.

So, I ate here twice so far; both times very disappointing. A simple hamburger, which was requested to be cooked &#34;medium&#34;, was clearly instead overcooked to &#34;well done&#34;. My friend ordered the vegetable salad, which was fine, but way over-dressed. She couldn&#39;t finish it for this reason, but chose not to say anything to staff. For the second trip, I tried the &#34;Firecracker Salmon&#34; appetizer, which was tasteless and not worth half the cost. <br>I was thinking of trying this place out for its Happy Hour. Now, I think instead I&#39;ll just go someplace else. Not worth the wait, at least not based on these two experiences.

I don&#39;t mind waiting considering it just opened. I expect it. What I do mind is being told 1:15 minutes...2:10 minutes ago. When I went to see how far down we were on the list, I was told :25 minutes. This was an hour ago. I just asked where we were and was told another 45 minutes. They offer bread and bananas to toddlers--I could have asked for that an hour ago if someone would have just been honest. I&#39;m more concerned about feeding my 3 year old. Or...maybe I could have gone somewhere else to eat.  Whatever your wait time, add an hour. Unfortunately, I can&#39;t comment on the food or the service. My toddler tore up the bananas, though

I love this place. I&#39;m so glad they built one here in ABQ. Our wait was only 15 minutes. It was so awesome. We went at about 3pm so perfect for after the lunch rush but before the dinner rush. Our server Karen was so amazing and super sweet. Our food came out hot and delicious and in a reasonable ticket time too. We also got cheesecake of course. I got the tiramisu cheesecake and my husband got the carrot cake. We both highly recommend them.

Reserve a table online. <br><br>Our server, Dillon C, seemed very upset from the beginning. When he greeted our table, he didn&#39;t make eye contact, he shifted his weight several times, kept checking his watch, and was constantly combing his bangs to the side. Seemed rushed to clear the table as soon as possible. Forgot that it was a birthday dinner and didn&#39;t remember the birthday girl&#39;s name after asking. <br><br>There are so many selections that it&#39;s really difficult to decide on just one entree or sides. The selections are fantastic! The food is great. The desserts are excellent!<br><br>Service was a total joke.<br><br>When we were gathering the funds to pay the bill, money on the table was being accounted for each person. We had boxes and bags on the tabletop, when the server asked, &#34;I can take this right?&#34; and before we could respond he walked off with the money. The server took the money that was apart of the bill fund. We looked at each other in disbelief. Nice right.

NO!!! Don&#39;t waste your time and money here, and you will spend a lot of money here, this place is super expensive for the type of food you are served. Everything comes from a box!! Please, instead go and support your local restaurants. There are so many great places in Albuquerque and this place unfortunately is not one of them! Yes, the place is huge and it looks great but the food is not tasty, maybe if you want dessert you can come here from time to time but my suggestion will be no and go find another local restaurant! Thanks!

Really not sure what all the fuss is about, it&#39;s honestly just another chain restaurant.  I have been  here twice and not really wild about the food.  My suggestion, go there for dessert and skip the food.  Oh and be prepared to wait, it doesn&#39;t matter if it&#39;s a week day or weekend you might have to wait up to 70 minutes.

I have been here twice now and both times have been sat away from other people. Both times I had my service dog with me. He has a vest with proper identification. Thanks for making your disgust towards my service dog even more obvious. It&#39;s hard enough having a disability, but then to get isolated because of it just turns the knife. At least your food was very good. Please improve your training with ADA

The Cheesecake Factory has been one of my favorite restaurants but I would recommend not going to this location until they get their stuff together. Our waitress was horrible! My husband ordered the Garlic noodles with Shrimp and was sick all night puking! So disappointing

I was fortunate to be able to go and eat before they open to the public, and I cannot believe how great it was.  The limited menu they offered was still bigger than a lot of restaurants total menu.  The portions are humongous!!!  From the appetizer to desert, my wife and I were unable to finish.  One could think that the quality would suffer with giant proportions, but it was all top quality, best food I have had in a long while.  The staff was great to a fault, even though it was chaotic due to training.
