When they open, GO, you will not be sorry!!!!

Went there for lunch to celebrate my grown daughter&#39;s birthday. The food was good but our waiter was slow and inattentive. There were long periods of time where we had no idea where he was. He only checked with us once during the meal to give us more water when our good arrived.

I really wanted to like this place but can&#39;t recommend it. I had the Sheila&#39;s Chicken Avocado Salad. It was huge and very good. I have since discovered that -- despite being called a salad -- the thing was 3,000 calories!!! There were decidedly too many downsides to this place to warrant going back:<br>1) Crowded <br>2) Loud<br>3) Pricey<br>4) Discouraged from lingering <br>I&#39;ve never been in a restaurant with so many tables short of Chinese cafeteria-style dining. The consequent noise level was awful. The aisles between were so narrow and busy it took nearly 5 minutes to exit the place!  While the salad was tasty it cost nearly $20, certainly not worth the price. No reservations accepted. <br><br>Won&#39;t. Be. Back.

Horrible experience got my order wrong didn&#39;t even apologize nor take it off the bill. Waited extra 30 minutes until they fixed it while everyone at my table ate enjoyed and finished I finally just told her I didn&#39;t even want to eat it there anymore and to just box it for me.
Came here for our daughter&#39;s 16th birthday. Food was great. Louie (manager) and Miranda (server) were awesome!!

Here goes. Right off the bat, we were disappointed. When arriving at the hostess counter, I was asked if I would prefer an indoor or outdoor table. I said, &#34;either, whichever is ready faster.&#34; I had my service dog and my partner with me at the time. The hostess was very polite when she asked us to stand aside and wait. However, in the time that we were waiting 2 or 3 couples of just two individuals (like us) arrived without reservations and were not asked to wait. They were immediately shown to tables. When I asked why this was I was told that our table was being cleaned. Although I spotted several clean and empty tables inside. We continued to wait and heard our hostess whispering with another individual about seating us outside because of &#34;the dog.&#34; Little did she know, my SERVICE DOG, is a licensed medical device. We were ultimately seated outside. Other servers walked by, who were incredibly excited about the service dog. I feel that when it comes to dealing with disabled customers, all of their staff definitely needs more training, as they appear to have none and very little etiquette when it comes to such matters. <br>The food itself was good, and they have a great veggie burger. However, their menu is very overwhelming. For being the place that is supposed to be known for their Cheesecake, it was quite underwhelming.

Disappointing. Service was great as our waiter was patient and attentive. He even comped the birthday cheesecakes. However, the food was not worth the high price. Our chicken and shrimp dish had obviously been under the heat lamp for awhile.   The cheesecakes we got were not good. We ordered their 30th anniversary cheesecake.  The chocolate truffle topping was hard, the cake portion stale and the cheesecake well past its &#34;best before&#34; date. Obviously these cakes had been in the dessert case too long. Perhaps CF needs fewer cheesecake choices so they rotate their stock a little quicker to provide the customer a better experience. <br>I&#39;d recommend Flying Star or Range Cafe for a fresher, tastier dessert. <br><br>UPDATE:  Cheesecake Factory asked me to contact them through the website so they could better respond to my comment. I did. No response from Cheesecake Factory.

The service was horrible had to wait 30 mins for my drinks, another 45 mins for my food and addition to that another 45 mins for my cheesecake that was ordered to go. I hope this place gets better on serving people&#39;s food instead of running around thinking what they need to do. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I am glad ABQ finally has a cheesecake factory but jeez its just absolutely ridiculous on the wait for the food and drinks.

Emmitt was our server this afternoon and I was very impressed with his professionalism.  The food was tasty but I can&#39;t help but wonder why they need 22 pages of items? We sat outside and I was glad as the noise inside is a bit too much for me.

My husband and I went on Monday night at 10pm, so the restaurant was empty. We ordered cheesecake to go. It took 10 minutes even though there were three people behind the counter and no other customers. I got the Oreo deluxe and my husband got the 30th anniversary chocolate cheesecake. My husband thought his had a strange after taste and did not finish it. The Oreos on mine were good, but the dessert was too sweet and tasted like it was made from low quality ingredients. I did not want to finish mine because it was not very good.  We both  miss Dee&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. This is not a place for good cheesecake, it is a place for extravagant looking desserts that taste Meh.

Don&#39;t eat the Eggplant Parmesan!   It was very bitter and I had to send it back. They need to take it off the menu.   Got a burger instead.  However my wife&#39;s fish n chips was good.  I ate some of hers.  A bit pricey for what you get.  Service was OK.  It was late.  But if you want cheesecake and go up and pay for it yourself instead of having the server bring it to you and add it to the bill, expect a 15 minute wait  as the orders go to the servers, not the counter customers.  We had the 30th Anniversary Cheesecake.  Wow, it was great.  Expensive but very good.

One of my top favorite places in town (for a chain).  We have had excellent waitstaff and wonderful food.  And who can&#39;t beat those deadly cheesecakes?  Haven&#39;t tried a single one yet that we don&#39;t care for.  Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter is still our favorite.  Drinks (adult) are tasty, food is divine.  Patio for people watching and taking in the fresh air.  What is not to like about this place (except for the wait to get a table sometimes!)

The problem with this place is the lack of consistency in both service and food prep. Starting with the hosts, sometimes the pagers work and sometimes they don&#39;t. Sometimes they try and find you and sometimes they don&#39;t and you end up waiting for a different table. Sometimes the waitstaff is good and sometimes they are lacking. Sometimes the food is what you remember from a cheesecake factory in a different city like Las Vegas (excellent) and sometimes it is definitely not. We&#39;ve been here six times since they opened hoping that it would get better. It has not. We do not recommend this particular cheesecake factory.

First time there, it was large, a decent wait but it was dinner time. The atmosphere was very pleasant! The colors, the mirrors and the lights really added a really &#34;breakfast at Tiffany&#39;s&#34; touch. I was with a group of friends and it was our first time all together. The food portions are huge, which was great for the price. However, my one thing I found off putting was the price of the drinks. The prices were not listed, but they also were the most expensive thing on my bill. Considering I ordered food, a drink and cheesecake. The cheesecake was the cheapest and the absolute BEST! So many flavors to try and it was great! Definitely lived up to the hype for dessert. Plus there is a ton of parking where this location is which is a great plus. It was too hot sit outside, but the patio they have looks delightful.

This Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t up to par as the other Cheesecake Factories I have had in other cities such as PHX, SLC and Las Vegas. The service is hit and miss. The Cheesecake is still good here but the factor of not knowing what type of service your going to get is troubling. I will return reluctantly because of the Cheesecake but I had better food and service at the Elephant Bar and the Melting Pot.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory in Vegas. While shopping we decided to give this place a try.  I can&#39;t really say anything bad, but I can&#39;t really say anything wonderful. Service was average.  The food was average.  For the price I expected better. I will say it is very pretty.  There is a lot to choose from that&#39;s for certain.  Hmmm.  Not much to say.  Average.

Visited just a couple weeks back with my work team. It was very busy on a Thursday during lunch hours, so we ended up finding a spot at the bar for all 5 of us. The food was good and the bar staff was very friendly like you would expect if you were sitting at a table. I want to visit again once the hype slows, because I want to enjoy the overall experience, rather than just a quick midday lunch.

Don&#39;t waste your time with curbside. We were told 25 minutes but waited an hour. Finally received mediocre cold food. $50 for a couple of appetizers and 2 slices of cheesecake. I know they are busy right now but if it&#39;s going to be an hour just tell people that.

Okay food is obviously delicious. I&#39;m only rating 3 stars because of the drink quality. I ordered the ultimate margarita and I tasted more triple sec than actual tequila. Kind of disappointing seeing that I was in Denver the week prior and dined at a cheese cake factory there and they made a really good ultimate marguerite there. My main disappointment stems from that because I&#39;m in New Mexico and should only expect any top notch margarita or one that has at least an inkling taste of tequila.

The veggie burger is hands down the best tasting veggie burger I have ever had. The strawberry cheese cake was pretty good too. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is nice. Will definitely come back

I went for my birthday and I had to wait 2 hours for a table then I go to ask if my table is ready and they asked me if I could wait a bit longer so I went across the street to the Elephant Bar this was on a Wednesday night thanks for ruining my birthday Cheesecake Factory

Food wasn&#39;t bad, the service sucked.  The hostess kept stepping on my daughter and didn&#39;t bother to apologize,  the wait for the food was over an hour and request for drink refills took forever.  Dessert took another 30 mins.  For all the people that applied for a job there, looks like the top servers were not picked.  With a restaurant thats busy a long wait is expected but, almost 3 hours is a bit much.

We came here for my mothers birthday. The wait was short, 10 minutes on a holiday. My dad is on a special diet so he can not have carbs and must eat low-sugar items. The waiter was kind enough to make sure his burger was lettuce wrapped and with a salad on the side. I asked for a medium well burger with no mushrooms. When we got our food, we realized we had no forks and asked for some. We asked three times and were nearly done with our meal before receiving them. Unfortunately my dads salad was sugar coated in a dressing that he didn&#39;t ask for. He then asked for another one, which the waiter got no additional charge, but the new dressing was still sweet. My burger had no toppings at all and was well done. Moms/birthday girls meal was perfect so luckily she still ate happy. <br>The dessert was good. No problems here and got what we wanted with free of charge coffee thanks to the waiter. <br>The main issue was the price versus the quality. I think we would&#39;ve had the same food made better elsewhere. Come for the dessert but maybe go have savory meals somewhere cheaper and local.

Attended the soft opening on Friday, February 19.  Sat at the bar and ordered the wings to start, followed by the Cuban sandwich, with a slice of cheesecake to go.  Very tasty.  Staff all new, supplemented with managers transplanted from within the organization.  All are eager and motivated, given that this is the first CCF in New Mexico.  Within a week or two, you will start seeing quite a few five star reviews.

The quality of the ingredients isn&#39;t really worth the price of the food to be honest. I would rather spend the same amount at a nicer local establishment so I&#39;m not supporting a huge chain. Their food is mediocre at best. I ordered a banana cheesecake (the selling point was the fresh bananas that supposedly come with) hoping they could at least get cheesecake right. Our server returned with a plain slice sans banana and dropped it off saying &#34;Sorry, we are out of bananas but here is a slice of the same kind without them!&#34; and walked off like she didn&#39;t just commit what should be a crime. Had I known there weren&#39;t fresh bananas obviously I wouldn&#39;t have ordered a banana cheesecake. Won&#39;t be coming back...

We waited 7 months to visit this place because of long wait times. We arrived at 2pm (not exactly lunch time) and picked the bar because there was still a 20 minute wait time. Food was awesome which included fish tacos, pasta Bellagio and Tuscan chicken) but the best part of the visit was Ashley who was friendly, efficient and genuinely engaged with her customers. We&#39;ll be back, but maybe at 3pm.

Terrible treatment due to being in a wheelchair. Out of everything on a Saturday night. I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over the place. They just opened this place and I feel they would best served by just closing it. Doesn&#39;t meet the standards their other locations set.
The banana cheesecake is the bomb . The service could be better, but as far as food.. the chefs in the back keep me coming back!

Waited an HOUR for our food to come out!  And purposely went at 2pm to miss the lunch crowd for my birthday!  Place was not busy at all and when our food came out very disappointing. My vegetable salad seemed half frozen half wilted!  Even my 8 year old niece said &#34;I don&#39;t want that tomato it looks old...&#34; LOL My fiancé ordered a salad and all that came out was a bowl of mixed greens lettuce that&#39;s it no dressing no carrots nothing just lettuce!  Could not believe it!  Never going back plus my birthday lunch was ruined.  Oh well....

It would be 1 star if it weren&#39;t for such a kind and understanding waitress.  The food itself was salty to the point where we had to return 2 dishes--Orange Beef, and Cashew Chicken. I&#39;ll go to other Cheesecake Factory, but not this one.

The food is always great. I will warn you it&#39;s a little pricey however you get what you pay for. Love it! Service is ok it&#39;s not too bad I feel like they could be a little friendlier but they aren&#39;t rude so it&#39;s great check it out!
I love The Cheesecake Factory and am really glad my friend told me about this new location. I only come into town every so often, so who knows how long it would have taken me to figure it out.

I ordered the mushroom burger. It was sooo good. The seasoning on the mushrooms was perfect. If you like garlic butter you will like this burger. The service was fast and friendly,  I will definitely come nack.

Food is always great at The Cheesecake Factory, no matter what location you visit. However, Albuquerque has this amazingly unique talent to destroy the image and standards that major chains, such as The Cheesecake Factory, Nordstrom Rack and Ruth&#39;s Chris steakhouse, just to name a few, work so hard to achieve. <br>The service. The quality of people hired.  You can shine a penny over and over and over again but that sh*t will never be a dime. <br>Suggestions: staff, loose all attitudes. Hold yourself to a higher standard. Try to look like you belong working at a high end restaurant not hookin&#39; on Central. Don&#39;t come to work high. Always respect your guests because they are the people that pay your rent! Don&#39;t be easily irritated. Move with purpose! <br>If you go, just be prepared to have the average Albuquerque service experience with top notch food. Maybe tip the cooks instead of the crappy servers.

This was my first time in the cheesecake factory in albuquerque. I ordered and received a green chilie cheese burger. It was cooked exactly right and tasted fine.  My question is, how can you serve frozen French fries with a burger like that. That ruined the plate.  The atmosphere suggests higher end food but you serve frozen fries. Not difficult to serve fresh fries....bummer...

I have been there twice a year apart the wait is ridiculous more than an hour.  Both times I have been my meal was not delivered everyone else in the party received their food I didn&#39;t.  I don&#39;t like the way they deliver the meal it doesn&#39;t come out for a table at the same time it comes out so maybe half the table receives food and the other half waits.  Both times I have been there they delivered the wrong food to someone in our party.  It is awkward to sit for 15 minutes while the rest of the group eats waiting for food.  If it only happens once I could excuse it but for it to happen twice is inexcusable. Such a poorly managed place.

The food was delicious I ordered the Louisiana chicken Pasta it was a very large portion I had leftovers and I did not let them go to waste.....the service was amazing! We did go on a week night which was not busy so there was no wait and everyone was very attentive and kind. I plan on going back again soon I probably will not go on a weekend because of the long wait time but I will be back!
Great service .. Food was delicious, only down fall was the wait! Their Raspberry cheesecake was the best!

Got a  to go order based strictly on the reviews about bad service. Cheesecake was great. I ordered the avocado egg rolls....they were good but they didn&#39;t put a lid on the sauce served with them so it spilled all over the dish....how do they not have lids??? So that right there tells me a lot based on other reviews.

this was a great Cheesecake Factory. the wait was 2 hours because it is a very new restaurant. the food was amazing &amp; the staff was really nice. the bacon bacon cheeseburger was the best. everything was well prepared &amp; yummy. everyone was nice. the Oreo milkshake was delicious and so was the vanilla bean cheesecake. this trip was definitely worth the wait. look for the gentleman with long hair &amp; glasses. he is very nice. oh! and also the decor in the restaurant was so lovely!!! the low light and amazing art work was the best. :) when they tell you that your going to be waiting a certain amount of time you can shave off 15 minutes give or take. the atmosphere is great. I would assume that this is a great place to go on a date or double date. you have to get cheesecake. if you are too full from that chicken bellagio then get it to go.

We weren&#39;t happy with the quality of the food for the price.  The service was lacking as well..our order was mixed up with someone else&#39;s after waiting for 25 minutes to get it.  Not a big fan, the best part was of course...the cheesecake.

Everything was great, the food,  the service , etc. It was pretty busy , so the food took a little time to arrive, but is understandable. The fact that the buzzer works in a couple of stores in the mall is nice. One hour of waiting goes by fast when you are shopping!
Amazing food with huge potions. The food taste homemade and the new Cheesecake Factory is beautiful. I can&#39;t wait to go back!! 5 stars
The food is very overpriced for the quality. The drinks are also pretty pricy. But the cheesecake is to die for... so good. The ambience is pretty nice too.

So glad we finally got a chance to eat here!  They have a huge menu with a little  something for everyone and the service was great! Also very quick. Everyone should try the cheesecake factory at least once!!

So excited for Albuquerque location to open.  We waited 3 hours first time....well worth it.  Have been here twice since, service great, food good and server (twice) Tyler is exceptional.  Only negative is that I have yet to have a cocktail that&#39;s fixed correctly.....bartenders need help.  Try happy hour bar menu....it&#39;s great!
Always a reliable good meal. Definitely explains why this place is always so busy. I would love to return.

Good food, large portions, not too expensive. Great cheesecake!Place was really busy and we had to wait for glasses to be washed to get our drinks. Our bread plates and a knife weren&#39;t clean, they had caked on food still on them. The waitress exchanged them right away for clean ones.

My friend and I went to get some cheese cake, we ended up ordering nachos and cheesecake and asked for it all to be sent out together at once. The nachos came out but we waited almost 20 minutes for the cheesecake to come out. My friend had to repeatedly ask for a glass of water and after waiting and waiting and waiting it only got filled when one of us had to yell out &#34;excuse me&#34; to our server or when we even asked another server if they could please refill our glasses. She had a big top right across from us that she had no problem refilling drinks constantly, and I get it sometimes big tops take a lot of your attention away from your other tables. But even after she refilled their drinks and still had water to spare in the pitcher for our drinks she walked right on by without even a glance over, knowing we asked for refills. But what was most irritating was when we cashed out my friend asked for one more refill and she acted like we weren&#39;t even there. We waited about ten min, she walked by us with the water pitcher refilling all of her other tables  but not us, finally my friend just said forget it and we left. Our tab was only 38 dollars and we still tipped her 13, we are servers ourselves and we get how it can be sometimes but that was just the shittiest service ever. That nice tip was solely for the karma of server life not for the crappy service.

I was blown away by how good the food is here!  We tried several different items from the extensive menu, and found everything to be absolutely delicious.  They put a lot of work into finding unique flavor combinations to please your palate.  The service was friendly and helpful.  The prices are pretty fair for the quality that you receive.  I can&#39;t wait to go back.

Went on friday.  Was told the wait would be 2 and a half hours.  I asked if I could make a reservation for Saturday.  I was told they do not take reservations.  Went to the standard dinner.  10 minute wait.  Great food.  I will try a different day but given the poor service reviews I am not expecting much. When the novelty wears off they better have their act together.

When my party of three arrived at the Cheesecake Factory, we were seated right away.<br>But then we waited. And waited. And waited. After twenty minutes, my friend went up to the hostess to tell her we hadn&#39;t been helped yet. She said she got our server&#39;s attention and that he&#39;d be right over.<br>But he wasn&#39;t. We waited ten more minutes and in that time we saw people at the table next to us be seated and helped right away. So my friend alerted the hostess again. The hostess said she saw our server (named Kevin) lounging at the bar so she changed us to a table with their best server (Ty). <br>After we were re-seated, everything was excellent.<br>But I&#39;ve never had to wait at a table for thirty minutes without being helped before.

We went for Sunday brunch. Very expensive and food is average. Huevos rancheros with black beans? Black beans aren&#39;t New Mexican, but restaurants continue to shove them at us instead of pinto beans. Know your customers. Very disappointing after all the hype. Cheesecake is their strength. We took home 1/2 original, 1/2 chocolate mousse, which were excellent. We&#39;ll stick to Monica&#39;s and The Range for Sunday brunch.

We went on a Saturday night, which was understandably busy. We decided to skip dinner and order cheesecake to go. We placed our order, and waited for over an hour. Finally we asked about order, we were told it would only be five more minutes. Fifteen minutes later we were getting a little upset, another waitress in the cheesecake area noticed and asked us what order we were waiting for. As she looked into what was going on, it was discovered that they lost our order. The waitress that originally helped (and told us it would only be five minutes longer) had done absolutely nothing. The cheesecake was good, but be prepared to wait at least two hours, and don&#39;t expect an apology from staff if they loose your order.

We went on a busy Saturday evening and it was pretty pact, so the wait was a good 45 minutes, but it was worth it. The seats looked like cozy sofas and they were very comfortable.   We sat outside and it was chilly and started to rain, but the waitress was quick to turn on the heaters. The  restaurant is clean and beautiful and The service was awesome! The menu was an outstanding vast verity.  My husband had the meet loaf and I had one of their steaks.  It was cooked perfectly with a side of  fried green beans, sprouts and mashed potatoes with bacon in them.  Delicious! I had it with a glass of red wine, perfect combination!
I forgot golden rule. Do not order anything other than dessert from The Factory.  Fettuccine was not worth it. Staff were great though.
Very Las Vegas; giant, fancy, kinda pricey for the fare.

First time at this or any CF in a long while. The wait we were given was 45-60 min, and it was on the long end, but they seated us quickly. The menu&#39;s a lot longer than I remember, but everything sounds delicious. Got the Crispy Shrimp sandwich, which is a lot bigger than I anticipated. But the Chinese Chicken Salad my mother got is ridiculously huge (might get it next time lol). Our server, Brian, was very helpful and had an answer ready for our questions. Need to make sure I get a smaller plate so I have room for a slice of cheesecake next time!

I had the lemon cheesecake and it was very good. The Chicken Bellagio is tasteless and not good at all, definitely not worth $17.99. The service was very good and the food came out quickly. I would recommend trying to go between meal hours or on Monday night; the wait can easily be 2 hours on a Friday night.
Have eaten there twice since it opened and have been happy with their food and service. Try the vegan Cobb salad!

Long wait for food. Loud loud atmosphere.   Lots of screaming children. Really hoped the food makes upfor this. The bread plates were dirty. The water tastes like pool water. Samosa app too salty. My dining companions liked the Asian salad and chicken tacos. I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants. I guess some people like this.

The server lady with the tattoos on her arms and near her hands ruined our entire dinner tonight. She was very rude and very passive aggressive. She was trying to rush us along. We didn&#39;t feel welcomed at all and I think she was very anti-child even though our children are very well behaved. Listen, people have kids, you were a kid once. You chose to be a server and therefore you must work with families whether you like it or not. She strategically tried bringing my kids food out first to &#34;distract&#34; them, rookie move. We chose to not let our kids eat it until we all received our food, about 15-20 minutes later. Next time I will have her warm it all back up as we eat together as a family. Our tip would have been a lot higher than the standard 15% had she shown respect, but she isn&#39;t about that. She was about herself, she was selfish. She is her own downfall. You&#39;ll get better tips if you treat families nice overall. Don&#39;t be selfish. Food was good.

Went to this restaurant for the first time last weekend, and wasn&#39;t very impressed. After a 20 minute wait the hostess showed us to our table, and we had to wait 10 minutes for our waiter to come (which was understandable since it was fairly busy). After we got our drinks we placed our orders,  and our waiter said he would bring some bread to the table. We had to wait 50 minutes for our food to arrive, and we never got our bread during our wait. I ordered the orange chicken and my husband ordered the fish and chips. Both of our meals were very bland, and not worth the cost.After we finished our meals we finally got our bread order, which we didn&#39;t even want anymore by that point. I won&#39;t be going back to any of these restaurants since I don&#39;t feel the food is good enough to warrant the cost that it is.
Came here for the first time and this place is pretty good! The atmosphere was very unique and the food was delicious.  Didn&#39;t get to try any cheesecake but will definitely try next time.

I didn&#39;t want to love this place. &#34;It&#39;s an overpriced chain!&#34;, I told myself. In truth, I was planning on eating here and feeling dirty after, like I was having a secret best friendship with my best friend&#39;s cousin but she could never find out cause she&#39;d be heartbroken. I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service I received a few Saturday evenings ago right around 5. We had a baby and a toddler with us so we were primed to pick apart anything we deemed unworthy of a yelp &#39;whoohoo&#39; review star. The menu itself is about 20 pages long so please bring your glasses if you need them and some patience;. If you&#39;re not great at making up your mind even when looking at smaller menus, this may not be the place for you. My issue with expansive menus is that I can&#39;t determine what it is they&#39;re good at cooking if they make everything. In order for a place with a 20 page menu to succeed, all of the menu items have to be at least a little better than average.Their cheesecake meets my guidelines. The appetizer was an array of fried avocado and zucchini which I really enjoyed. For dinner, I had pasta dish made with garlic sauce and tossed with veggies--it made me happy. I have to say that the service towards the end was a bit spotty because the servers were in the midst of shift change so if I had feedback to offer it would be to wait until your last table is served to tag team in your partner. Other than that, I&#39;d go back for the cheesecake alone. If you want to dine here but don&#39;t want to pay an arm and a leg I suggest you visit during the week and dine on an appetizer and a split a slice of cheesecake.

Hubby and I have dined at Cheesecake Factory restaurants all over the U.S.  Favorite menu items are Miso Salmon and soy sauce, sesame seed Edamame.  Hubby ordered a burger and I ordered my usual.  The Miso Salmon arrived with a huge trim of burned, black char around the entire piece of salmon and the driest inner salmon I&#39;ve ever seen.  I looked at the server and explained that I order this item once a week at other CCF&#39;s and it never arrives so overcooked as to have a char edge around it.  The server agreed and sent it back.  A manager came to apologize and said they were remedying the situation.  A new plate of Miso Salmon arrived.  I cut into it and it was like raw sushi, not cooked at all.  The edamame arrived and was undercooked.  First time that has ever happened.  How hard can it be to pan fry edamame?  I didn&#39;t complain about the edamame as hubby said he&#39;d bring it back and microwave the order.  I sent the salmon back and asked for it to be removed from the bill.  The manager came over again and apologized.  He said the Miso Salmon would be removed from the bill; however, he&#39;d sent it back to be properly cooked.  The manager sounded confident they could get this right; thus, I agreed to wait. The waitress arrived next and presented the bill, Miso Salmon removed.  Since the bill arrived with the Miso Salmon removed as promised but without the Miso Salmon re-cooked, I figured the chef had screwed up a third time.  The manager showed up again, apologized, said there had been a misunderstanding of my instructions and the salmon would not be coming out.  I just wanted out of there at that point so I could go to the nearest Taco Bell, where they always present a perfect Taco Supreme.  This particular CCF needs to charge Taco Bell prices until they get their act together.  Additionally, given the myriad Yelp complaints about this CCF, their corporate management should terminate the manager/chef, bring in a new team overseen by someone from the Atlanta, GA or San Mateo, California CCF restaurants to oversee things until this locale lives up to the name.  At present, they are ruining the good will and solid reputation that other CCF&#39;s have built over the years.

I have a confession to make. I am a server myself and I considered applying here. Dodged that bullet because I really hate disappointing people. You know how people say, &#34;KILL IT WITH FIRE!&#34; when they see a large, hairy, evil spider or something equally repulsive? That&#39;s how I feel when I think of The Cheesecake Factory. I was so excited when I heard they would be opening up a Cheesecake Factory here in Albuquerque. I have been to one in Seattle and both the food and service were great. Absolutely not the case here. I&#39;ve tried this place three times and the only thing that has been consistent is the cheesecake. And that&#39;s because it&#39;s not even made here. Service sucks, food sucks. Very slow. Twice we waited for a very long time to even be acknowledged at our table. We told our waitress we needed one more minute with the menu and she didn&#39;t return for 20 minutes!! She literally showed up one minute prior to when we said we were just going to get up and leave. Ordered nachos and they were cold. Boyfriends pasta tasted like it was boiled in chlorine/swimming pool water. He had to send it back one time because it was absolute mush. My spaghetti was BEYOND salty. The kind of salty that left us both gasping for water. I have never in my life sent a plate of food back, but we both had to do that here. I do like the macaroni and cheese burger but it is very salty as well. This place is overhyped and overpriced. I will only return for to-go cheesecake.

Ok, I know this place just opened, but really!  Came here at 5:00 with my family.  Wait was quoted at 2 hours.  Decided to just get cheesecake to go, and eat dinner elsewhere.   Stood in line at the counter for 40 minutes just to place a to-go order of cheesecake.  Then was told I&#39;d have to wait another 30 minutes to get my order.  Waited the 30 minutes and then could not get to the counter to pick up my order.  Counter was being blocked by hoardes of people.  What type of system is this?  People swamping the counter, pushing and shoving.  An hour and a half of my time and $40 later, I squeezed my way out.  Cheesecake was good, though.  We do live our chain restaurants in Albuquerque!

This is an update to my earlier review, I should have exercised better judgement and not eaten the meal my server delivered, I puked my guts out later that evening. Today is Tuesday, I puked so hard my sides are still sore. Eating at this location is hazardous to your health.

The Cheesecake factory is excellent! I am so glad we finally got one in NM. I had a minor problem with my burger (the bun was totally hard on one side, probably from the heat lamp) but I told my waitress and she gave me a new one right away. It&#39;s always amazing tasting and the price is right for the quality and quantity of food you get. I always have to get a box since I can&#39;t finish it all. The ambiance is great and I will be returning here again and again!

I realize the Cheesecake Factory is new to town, but they could do a better job to accommodate the crowds wanting to try something new. I wasn&#39;t that thrilled to go there in the first place having been in other states, but a large group of us wanted to try it out for someone&#39;s birthday so I obliged. Two of us arrived early to reserve a spot for 10 people, and we were told we needed a manager&#39;s approval for groups of that size, so I was pulled out of the line to wait. Meanwhile, they are accepting names for other parties pushing us further and further down the list. A manager eventually came up to us and told us it would be 2.5 to 3 hours for a group of 10. When we asked why they didn&#39;t accept reservations, the manager told us it was because guests waiting in line get mad when they see empty tables being reserved for other guests. Hmm, I wonder how other restaurants get away with it? Perhaps they don&#39;t have long lines of guests waiting and getting mad because they accept reservation for large parties to begin with. I may give Cheesecake another try, but it will be after a long, long period of time to let the newness wear off.

Do you crave overpriced,  mass produced,  highly processed,  caloric intense &#34;food&#34; that you wait 3 hours to eat?  Well Albuquerque, does TCF have a treat for you!    Ever since they opened in Beverly Hills in the 70s this gem of an eatery had been churning out food for the masses.  They don&#39;t have any professional tasters and why would you need those?  All of their food is chock full of sugar and sodium to mask the true taste.   A 21 page menu....imagine how fresh most of those items are?  Even the cheesecake is flat but oh so full of sugar.  I mean come on.  It is hard to make a good NY style cheesecake!!!   Sarcasm.   I often wonder why, in a city and state so full of culture, hundreds of years of the most unique and tasty food, some of the freshest and most storied ingredients that that we allow a fortune 500 business with subpar food onto the market.  Not only that a large majority of you will wait hours and endure crap service to ravenously give it a 5 star review.  Grow a pair and call it like it is....another corporate chain who got a coveted liquor license in a prime location that probably paid off a New Mexico family so you could drink a fritz sugary watered vodka drink on GNO.   We need to start blocking these places in uptown.   It is enough

All I can say is this place is diabetic danger zone! Everything here is so sweet and I am not talking about the cheesecake! This is a dangerous place for diabetics and I&#39;m sure many left in diabetic comas. Horrible, low quality, high sugar food.

My wife and I have been here a couple of times. The servers have been nothing short of wonderful. The food has been outstanding every time we go. One of my favorites are the carne asada steak medallions. Really delicious, as are the chicken tacos. Looking forward to our next visit.

We&#39;ve been twice since The Cheesecake Factory opened in Albuquerque.  The first time, we waited over an hour to get in and once in, service was bad.  Because the restaurant just opened, we gave the bad service and wait time a pass.  But after being opened for over a month now, we decided to try the CCF again.  This time, we waited 30 minutes to get in and the service was HORRIBLE.  We waited 20 minutes after being seated at our table before a waitress (Kaitlyn or Caitlyn) showed up to get our drink order.  It took her 10 minutes more to bring us our drinks. During the course of the meal, our glasses were empty, and stayed empty.  The waitress passed our table several times and ignored the fact that they were empty.  The food took 20 minutes from order time to table time.  I got the fish and chips and the fish was mealy and chewy.  This tells me the fish wasn&#39;t fresh.  It was not very good at.  We had fried Zucchini as an appetizer. The appetizer was cold.  How can an appetizer be cold?  This place with it&#39;s high prices needs to vastly improve if they want to stay in business.  Our waitress was so bad that after we finished eating, we waited 20 more minutes before we got our check and another 10 minutes for her to return our credit card.  Drink glasses were empty most of the meal. It was a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

I don&#39;t usually write a review but feel compelled to today. I ate there at lunch today with two coworkers. Although the line was long, it didn&#39;t take too long to get in (about 20 min).  When we finally got it, we had a choice of the bar high top or the patio (it was a cold and windy day).  We went with the high top.  After a bit of waiting for food, a regular table opened up close to us. We asked to be moved and were promptly told &#39;no.&#39;  We just got our food and the waitress wanted to take the bread, we said &#39;no.&#39;  I asked for a doggie bag for my soup and she said she would box it. She started to pick up the bowl by sticking her finger down in it and realized she shouldn&#39;t do that but piled dirty dishes on the plate as she took it off the table.  She also reached over my coworkers dish and almost put her arm in her food. The manager never came around to tables to see how folks were doing.  I was not impressed.  I won&#39;t be back.

The hostess was incredibly snotty and short tempered with my brother in law when we went to put our name in for waiting for a table. (I feel she judged him based on his clothing at the time...it was so terribly rude that I have never seen a potential customer treated this way in a very long time) She refused to let us put our name in, refused to give us a beeper for the wait and told us it would be &#34;over 2 hours&#34; to even be put on the waiting list that evening. When I got there, he and I went back to ask her a question about waiting, she obviously ignored us standing there and seemed to be talking to some personal friends instead. We decided to just grab some cheese cake while we were there and head home. (And also noticed that the wait line wasn&#39;t nearly at &#34;over 2 hours&#34; capacity and many many booths and tables were in fact sitting empty!) Wait staff screaming  &#34;out of the way&#34; at customers as they were moving cakes to the counter. Children in the line to buy cake were touching orders left on the counter. Pushing and shoving, absolute chaos the whole time...almost took 45 minutes for 4 slices of cake to go! I probably won&#39;t go back...being THAT rude to a potential customer is just unacceptable no matter what the circumstances.

Extremely expensive the jambalaya was nasty the Linguini was nasty everything way too salty it&#39;s like they didn&#39;t even know what other spices could go in the food except salt. They put the utensils fork and knives on the table that rarely gets wiped sufficiently to be clean and they put the napkin in a cup the utensils should be in. an elevated place to eat fine.... dining.... I have never in my life seen my fork and knife directly on the table where other people spill food, drop food out of their mouth, spilled drinks, kids touch so unsanitary it&#39;s ridiculous, that is the worst dining experience and the poorest most disgusting thing to do in a nice supposedly elevated restaurant. the only thing good about this place is the cheesecake and that is expensive and very small slice and their out of many different kinds it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory how can they be out of any kind of Cheesecake ridiculous. do not come here way better to go to crackin crab.
I don&#39;t care for Chain restaurants, but this place is one of my favorites to go to.  So far, everything has been really good...sometimes there is a wait, but worth it.

Food was alright, overpriced but comes in very large portions. Also, thanks for the food poisoning! It&#39;s too bad that chicken fettuccine Alfredo  didn&#39;t taste as good coming out as it did going in. What a great way to spend my 20th birthday! The servers were very polite and well attending tho!
I&#39;ve been there 4 times and I love this place. They offer variety items on the menu. And I always take some cheese cakes to go after I finish my meal. Will be back soon!
Food was ok, but it took nearly 4 hours for lunch, and the bill was over $100 for 4 people.  Won&#39;t be going back anytime soon....

I&#39;ve only been here once because the wait time to be seated is ridiculous. We waited for about an hour or so. I think that&#39;s only because it&#39;s new, so it&#39;s still a hype. Once that dies down, I&#39;ll probably be back. It&#39;s a bit pricey, but the serving size was pretty big. Our server was really nice; she even got in a conversation with my brother. However, we couldn&#39;t get a hold of her often because of the crowd. I&#39;m glad that we ordered an appetizer because it took a long time for our food to arrive. I ordered the carbonara, which was good. I already kind of lost my appetite by the time the food was served though so I ended up taking the rest of it to go.

Food was mediocre at best.  Also, had them set up a large party next to us and separated them instead of moving the table on the other side of us to accommodate the party.  Large party also started giving us a hard time.  The Cheesecake Factory should be embarrassed about that.  So should the ridiculous ladies next to us.

Not impressed with our overall experience. When we were seated, our booth had crumbs all over the seat, which I just used a napkin to wipe off. Our waiter was not very personable and we had to ask multiple times for things (like a replacement napkin and our appetizer...) We ordered the macaroni balls which were my favorite, falafel ball salad which was not good, the bang bang chicken and shrimp which was ok and the kids pizza, which my son enjoyed but it didn&#39;t look very appetizing.. The falafel balls tasted microwaved and there was way too much kale in it. The dressing they used was good at least. The bang bang chicken and shrimp was mostly sauce and little bits of chicken and shrimp. It seemed as if they had made a big pot of it and we got the serving that was scraped out of the bottom of the pot. It would have been good if the chicken chunks were larger and they used whole shrimp instead of chopped up shrimp. There were also no vegetables which I thought was strange... The pepperonis on the pizza were all burned around the edges, which thankfully, my picky toddler did not complain about.  He had an upset stomach shortly after eating, which I am wondering could be related to the pizza he ate?? It might be worth it to go there just for dessert, since that is what they&#39;re most known for, but if you are looking for a good quality meal, you might want to try elsewhere..

New restaurant it is very clean and classy place. we were told that wait was 45 minutes but we were able to sit at the and order dinner. This only took about 15 minutes. The plates are huge and very tasty. I recommend the soups and the chicken parm. sandwich. The drinks are priced right as well. This place is a must-visit if you&#39;re hungry for a good meal that&#39;s priced reasonably. We&#39;ll go back for sure!
Our service was fantastic! The best experience  we have had here. Jonathon C was attentive but not hovering and very helpful with suggestions. Our food was great! Great experience!

After waiting for over an hour to be seated we were met with a kind but overly harried server who, though she tried hard, really needed more training.  Her effort is the only reason why this Cheesecake Factory earned any rating whatsoever from us.  The food was absolutely, positively disgusting and we really do eat anything.  I honestly believe that there&#39;s less salt in the Dead Sea than there was in our appetizers and main courses and this rendered the meal inedible.  We did not stay for dessert since, one, the place was packed and there was an overall sense of lingering not being welcomed and, two, we didn&#39;t particularly wish to linger as we were hungry for something edible.  If you&#39;re looking for a crowded, rushed environment, frantic waitstaff, and remarkably awful yet expensive food, this Cheesecake Factory has you covered on all aspects.  For their sake, I do hope the cheesecake is good, but I can&#39;t recommend and won&#39;t return.

We ordered Avocado egg rolls one of them had a hair inside the avocado. My half chicken came out broken into pieces, dry, over cooked and cold. The skin on the chicken was shriveled up like it was old, definitely not freshly cooked, the mashed potatoes were somewhat warm. We were on a double date with another couple so I didn&#39;t want to say anything. I&#39;ve been to many different Cheesecake Factory&#39;s in other states and haven&#39;t had any problems before, sorry to say this one was disappointing.
Great waitress, amazing food. A new favorite restaurant.
We went yesterday evening; the wait wasn&#39;t bad at all (party of 4), our server was extremely nice, and the food was good! Cheesecake to go was convenient (:
Good food, delicious cheesecake, great service. Long wait as expected but worth it! Had the crispy fish tacos and an amazing white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake.
Poor service. I  went during lunch it wasn&#39;t too packed yet had poor  service. The food was mediocre. Was very disappointing.

First trip to this location... Have eaten at other locations in Arizona, Los Angeles, etc.  Food is as always, exceptional. The wait for the food however, is a bit ridiculous. Lots of servers standing around, but no real rush or explanation as to why it takes so long.  Our server had no help with food delivery. Two plates were delivered and we had to wait almost 8 minutes for the additional two plates.   We ordered a refill ice tea and we were done with the meal by the time the server appeared.  It seemed to me like a more expensive Applebee&#39;s.  I&#39;d rather have a mom and pop restaurant if this service is indicative of this location.
in and out of there is no time, was totally impressed for picking up two slices of cheesecake for desert at dinner.
Took 10 minutes to get a beer. The food was nominal compared to the price. And I have never written a review before in my life.

Nothing tops off an afternoon of shopping better than a great meal at an amazing place... or so we thought. When we first walked in we expected the crowd at the front so we were ready to wait until we were told we could sit in the bar area which we took full advantage of and thought to ourselves SCORE!... no wait. A couple of minutes later our waitress greeted us and took our drink order. Ten minutes later we got our drinks and placed our order right away so there wouldn&#39;t be too much of a delay since the place was getting busy. 35-40 minutes later we received our entrees, we could tell our waitress left them sitting for a while because the top was cold and it wasn&#39;t until we stirred them that they actually were warm enough to eat. During the 35 minutes that we waited we saw our waitress a couple of times and she kept telling us they were still working on our order then she disappeared for a while--the adjacent waitress could probably tell we were becoming aggravated and she came over to check on us and offered to refill our drinks which we were thankful for since our own waitress didn&#39;t do so. In fact, we waited so long, the tables that were seated after us received their food 10-15 minutes before we did. Our waitress never apologized for the wait nor did she offer anything else, she dropped off our food and disappeared again. Once we finished she promptly brought us our check, she wasted no time ringing us up--I wish she would have been that quick with our food. I have to give credit to this place for having an amazing atmosphere, the décor is beautiful and comfortable even though it was really busy during our visit. Also, once we received our food, the taste was great and the portion just right. I&#39;m not sure what it&#39;s going to take to fix the service and attitude of the workers at this location, none (except for the adjacent waitress) seemed to care, even the on duty manager didn&#39;t seemed bothered by the mounting complaints as we saw him comping checks from other unhappy customers. I suppose we could have complained to him directly and maybe had our check comped as well but judging by his attitude and the way he disrespecfully rolled his eyes at the customers he comped, it would have been a waste and I would have had some choice words for him if he rolled his eyes at me as well so we instead called it a loss and left. This is by far the most mismanaged location I have ever been to-- there needs to be change from the top. Prior to posting this review I read previous reviews and more importantly the responses from the &#34;business manager&#34; to all the complaints posted on this forum which amounted to no more than a poor excuse for an apology to my fellow yelpers, I honestly expect the same lacking response to this posting. I challenge management to make a change, a lasting change that will save this location otherwise it is doomed to go the way of most big chain restaurants--mediocre and forgettable.

We went with a party of five on a weekend without a reservation. Don&#39;t do that! It took over an hour to be seated. The food was average at best. It took forever to get to us and didn&#39;t taste all that good. It was very expensive too. I can think of better places to eat for the money. The cheesecake was great, but I&#39;ll never eat anything but that there again.
Try the lemon raspberry cheesecake. All of the fruity cheesecakes rock! The food is always yummy too.

i&#39;m giving this place a single star do to the service or the lack there of.  we were sitting here for almost 2 1/2 hours waiting for our order.  the kids were waiting even longer for the desert.  I find it really impossible for a place of this stature has this type of serviceus.   cheesecake used to be one of my favorite places until I came to albuquerque.

The Cheesecake Factory  <br>         In Albuquerque, New Mexico the state&#39;s new restaurant the Cheesecake Factory that is well known around the United States recently opened. With a wait up to 3 hours for a party of two. That is the first thing the hostess told us when we walking in the door.  The city was excited for the new addition to the city restaurants. The outside of the building was eye drawing especially because it is in the Mall shopping center. It was the new hot spot that is now open from 11am-11pm and Friday - Saturday extender their closing till 12:30. <br>         The week of opening I waiting two hours to be seated for a party of two. When I was seated I waited another 30 minutes for someone to take my drink order. I then began to get frustrated. Not being able to have service also well waiting that was irritating. Finally a server came to get our drink order by then I had asked to talk to a manager. <br>        After waiting for service for almost 45 minutes, not having anyone ask what we wanted to drink or if we were ready to order, we began to get service fast and in a hurry. The food turned out amazing everything came fast and was just like it appeared to be in the picture. The service eventually turned out to be better. And well having our meals completely gave to us for free. Not having to pay even for a soda. We also received a 50 dollar gift card. <br>                 The first week in a new state was crazy for the factory. New servers and a new business is a lot to take in. The company is a great company the servers, manager, hostess, and everyone else was very nice and welcoming. The manager you could see was very stressed out and just needed a break before he completely broke down. This issue was not in his control, he had a 3 hour wait waiting outside. There&#39;s not more the man could do but stay calm and do what he did by making sure everyone was to be pleased and also happy. The meals we order was a chicken pasta which my mother got. I got a bacon cheese burger that had tasted like the most amazing bacon ever! I was very pleased with the burger.  <br>The Cheesecake Factory in Albuquerque, New Mexico turned out to be a great dinner and a huge hit! The food was amazing. It came out looking just like it did on the menu for the restaurant.  Everyone in New Mexico loved it and online it had no bad reviews. We New Mexicans were happy to have something new and something only other states had. This turned out to be a benefiting change for the City. I will love to attend the Cheesecake Factory again in the future.  I give this The Cheese Cake Factory a rating of a 4 out of 5 just because after everything the food was still amazing. The restaurant was a great first time and love it shot. I look forward to going back and having their amazing famous cheesecake.

I forgave waiting a while to order a drink. And the lack of knowledge our bartender had about the food menu. The salads came out wrong and he apologized and he fixed the check. But when my wife&#39;s food got there and 45 more minutes went by before I had to make a scene to call attention that I had no food. It was crazy. Then the manager doesn&#39;t even give us the courtesy of coming by. Just has the bartender to ask if I even want it.  Yeah! Still haven&#39;t had dinner. I ate while drinking my wife&#39;s water cause not only no water refill but no offer for another beer. He honestly hurt himself. I was ready to spend around $120 on dinner. But oh well the bill was 39 and we still have him 10. Never even met a manager. Never was offered dessert. Even though we were looking around at the cheesecakes. Just over all not good. I hope it&#39;s growing pains but for me it will be another year before I even care to give them another shot. If at all. First time at any Cheesecake Factory. Don&#39;t know that I care to go back. Plenty of great mom and pop places here. They treat people better and at least I meet someone besides the bartender. Obviously I don&#39;t blame the bartender for the back of house mistake. But he didn&#39;t wow me either. Nor did he even try

Such a step down from the ones in Denver and Vegas.  The service was so slow, but I was going to let that slide because I know they&#39;re pretty new.  But we did have to ask where our appetizer was.  It must have been sitting because when it got to us, it was lukewarm.  We&#39;d ordered the same thing in Denver and Vegas and it was delicious, fried mac and cheese balls ($10.35).  Here, they were bad.  The mac and cheese tasted like it came out of a box, and it was very salty.  No one ate it.  Everyone thought the food was okay.  When the waitperson came back to the table at the end of our meal, I explained what was wrong with the appetizer, as it was clear no one ate it.  She replied, &#34;Okay.  I&#39;ll tell them.&#34;  I assumed when the check came, there&#39;d be no charge for it.  Wrong.  My experience in restaurants has always been that you order something that&#39;s not good, you don&#39;t eat, you tell staff, they will refund it.  I guess I should have just flat out asked.  Maybe my fault.  But we won&#39;t be going back to Cheesecake Factory in Albuquerque.
